Milly is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her young brothers. 

She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more boxes of cosmetics, weaves, and braids. She also generates additional income through selling soft drinks. 

She works from home and sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of cosmetics. She aspires to own a bridal salon and also to buy land and build her own house. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cosmetics, braids, and weaves.

loans.name: Nelson Agustin

texts.es:
NELSON  tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene cuatro hijos, vive con los hijos y con la esposa en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia d elos ríos.

La VRC LA PAULINA, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto la Paulina, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

NELSON  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, gallinas y  cerdos y alimento para los animales.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras y los animales. Las compras y ventas lo hace  en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El sueño es tener un terreno y una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es comprarce un carro. En el tiempo libre le gusta asistir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Nelson, 33, lives in a common-law marriage and has four children. He lives with them and his wife in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos province. Communal bank La Paulina is located in the village Puerto Pechiche, Recinto La Paulina, which is located in the Pueblo Viejo canton. The main activities in the region are agriculture and livestock.

Nelson works with agriculture, growing corn and raising chickens and pigs. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, compost, chickens, pigs and animal feed. With this loan, he will be able to buy everything he needs for his plantations and his animals. He will buy the supplies in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to have his own land and a house. His challenge is to buy a car. During his free time, he likes to go to church.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, chickens, pigs and feed.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru: Музафару 24 года. Он живет в сельской местности, далеко от города. Музафар добросовестный человек и он имеет порядочную и благополучную семью. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому недавно исполнилась 2 года. Он более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги мастера по ремонту дома. Он хорошо знает все тонкости своего дела. Музафар получил это мастерство от своего отца. Его отец тоже был хорошим мастером деревни. Его брат не имеет работу и ему срочно необходимо найти работу и зарабатывать деньги. Его брат хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию, но не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета. Он попросил Музафара помочь ему. Музафар с такой целью обратился за займом. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета для брата. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muzafar is 24 years old. He lives in a rural area, far away from town. Muzafar is a conscientious person. He has a good  tight-knit family. He is married and is raising one child, who recently turned two. For over five years, Muzafar has been providing services as a home repairs contractor. He is a master of his trade. He has learned his trade from his father, who was known as a good tradesman in his village too. Muzafar’s brother is unemployed and must urgently find a job and start earning money. He would like to go to the Russian Federation for work but lacks the funds for an airfare. He has asked Muzafar to help him. This is the reason Muzafar has applied for a loan. He is applying for a loan in the amount of 3,000 TJS to buy an airplane ticket for his brother. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an air ticket for his brother.

loans.name: Mario Abel

texts.es: Mario, es habitante del barrio Georgina Andrade, una zona donde los habitantes son de muy escasos recursos, junto a su esposa busca como salir adelante y brindarles los estudios a sus hijos quienes tienen las edades de 10 y 12 años. Mario se dedica a la venta de espejos y cuadros decorados, los cuales es muy usual verlos a menudo en las casas Nicaragüenses, los compra ya elaborados y los vende. El solicita el apoyo de crédito para poder invertir en su negocio, ya que este es el único medio de ingresos para el sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Mario lives in the Georgina Andrade neighborhood, a place where inhabitants have very few resources. He and his wife are looking for ways to get ahead and provide their children, who are 10 and 12 years old, the opportunity to study. 

Mario works selling mirrors and decorative picture frames, which are seen commonly in Nicaraguan homes. He buys them already manufactured and he resells them. He requests the support of a loan so that he may invest in his business, since this is his only means of income to provide sustenance for his family.

loans.use: to invest in mirrors and decorative picture frames.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is married and has three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (maid and brother).  She owns a restaurant and has been in this business for five years.  She generates additional income by selling cold, bottled water.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use this amount to buy ingredients to use in the meals she will serve, including more bunches of green bananas, onions, Irish and sweet potatoes, beef and fresh beans. She works at the market seven days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters.

She aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant and to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to use in the meals she will serve, including Irish and sweet potatoes, beef and fresh beans

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson lives in Malindi area, in Kenya. He has two businesses running right now. He has a motorcycle transport business and a tea room. He is planning to set up a retail shop next to the tea room business. He wants to have a diversified portfolio of businesses in the area. The major challenges that he faces are weather and insurance charges; both of these cut his income.

He knew of Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan. He will use the loan to buy sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. These items will stock the retail shop that he is planning to set up. The extra income that he raises from the business will pay school fees for his child and improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the new shop he is setting up, including sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: El señor Henry habita en el municipio de Ticiantepe, trabaja duro para poder sacar adelante a su familia, el vende frutas y verduras todos los dias, su esposa lo apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que ella por su parte vende productos de bellazas, cosmeticos, etc. con este credito don Henry invertira en su negocio ya que quiere aprovechar la temporada alta. y el quiere obtener mejores ingresos para que sus condiciones de vida mejore y poder cumplir su sueño que es construir su casa. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Henry lives in the town of Ticiantepe. He works hard every day selling fruit and vegetables to help his family get ahead. His wife helps him with the household costs by selling beauty products, cosmetics, etc. Henry will use this loan to invest in his business as he wants to take advantage of the high season. He wants to earn higher profits so that he can improve his quality of life and achieve his dream of building his own house. He is very thankful for the support Afodenic and Kiva have given him.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa de 42 años de edad, sus hijos ya son independientes y mayores, ella se dedica a vender literatura y su esposo trabaja en artes plásticas y pintura. Con el crédito desea invertir en levantar la pared de su casa de concreto, actualmente la tiene de madera lo que con el tiempo se irá destruyendo poco a poco, por eso antes que suceda Teresa quiere invertir en mejorar su hogar para el bienestar y seguridad de la familia.
texts.en: Teresa is 42 years old. Her children are grown up and independent. She is a bookseller and her husband works with sculptures and paintings. She wants to invest this loan in building a concrete wall for her house, which is currently made of wood and gradually decaying. Teresa wants to improve her home for the wellbeing and safety of her family.

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is married and has three children. All her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her sister’s child).  She has a beauty salon business, and she has been in this business for 13 years. She works in a shop, seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and on-and-off electricity.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, and a hand dryer.

She aspires to own a fully-stocked beauty salon and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, and a hand dryer.

loans.name: Julio Alfredo

texts.es:
JULIO tiene 25 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo en casa de los padres en la ciudad de Ventans Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC LA PAULINA, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto la Paulina, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

JULIO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas, patos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, insecticidas, abono orgánico y balanceado para los animales.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras de maíz, arroz. Las compras y ventas lo hace  en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El sueño es comprar una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Julio is 25 years old, single, and has one son. He lives with his son in his parent's house in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. The communal bank La Paulina is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish, in the district of La Paulina. This area belongs to the Pueblo Viejo region. The communal bank members make a living working in agriculture and livestock. 
Julio works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He also raises hens and ducks. He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer, insecticide, organic manure and animal feed. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy what is necessary for planting the corn and rice. He does all of the buying and selling in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to buy a house. In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, fertilizers, insecticides, manure and animal feed.

loans.name: Gerardo Leonel

texts.es:
GERARDO tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC LA PAULINA, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto la Paulina, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

GERARDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos,fertilizantes, polvillo, morocho.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar los sembríos y la cosecha. Las compras y ventas lo hace  en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El sueño es comprarse un lote de terreno para seguir sembrando.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 22, is single and does not have any children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Rios. The communal bank La Paulina is in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, in the zone of La Paulina. It belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo, where the inhabitants work in farming and livestock. 
Gerardo works as a farmer, growing corn and rice, as well as raising hens and pigs. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, urea, compost, fertilizer, animal feed and a type of dense corn ("morocho"). With the help of the loan, he will be able to improve his plantings and his harvest. 
Gerardo does his purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to buy a piece of land to cultivate. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase urea, compost, fertilizer, corn and animal feed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member, her mother. Rose has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Rose generates additional income through hair plaiting. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on a wholesale basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Rose aspires to import used clothes, educate her children up to the university level, and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer was born in 1988. She lives in Dair Alla, Jordan, with her husband and two children. Ghadeer is currently working as a farmer, and her husband has been working in making bicycles since seven years ago. Her husband started his project by collecting parts and putting them together to create bicycles. He is seeking to expand his project in the future. Now, Ghadeer is seeking a youth loan, to buy a machine that creates bicycles for her husband's business. The loan will enable him to increase the number of products he can offer to customers.

loans.use: To buy a machine that creates bicycles, for her husband's bicycle-making and -sales business

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 52 years old. He lives in the Tskaltubo district with his father, who is provided with a retirement pension. Vazha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow and a calf, whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, they have a vineyard and a hectare of agricultural land where maize is grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese at local markets at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vazha requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Vazha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this loan, Vazha will purchase two additional milking cows with which he will be able to produce more cheese to sell. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows

loans.name: Paulinah

texts.en: Paulinah is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as dedicated, visionary, and honest. She has taken a loan of KES 16,500 to buy a water dispenser that will benefit six family members. This will provide them access to clean water. Paulinah works in farming and rearing of livestock to earn a living. She faces the challenges of lack of capital and high transport costs in her business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. Cecelia has been in the farming business for more than six years now. She helps her husband in tilling their farm. This is the source of their income.

Cecelia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. In the future, Cecelia hopes to expand their farm so that it will generate more income, which is necessary to meet the needs of the family and for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Gloria Karina

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos en una aldea del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Gloria lleva 11 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, ella cultiva pataste. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. con los dos prestamos anteriores ha mejorado su plantación y producción de pataste. actualmente ha solicitado un tercer préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras para seguir dándole mantenimiento al cultivo. va comprar insumos como fertilizantes y fungicidas. continua motivada a seguir ampliando y mejorando su cultivo.
texts.en: Gloria is 32 and a single mother. She and her two children live in a village in Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Gloria has worked in agriculture for 11 years, growing chayote. She sells her produce in the local market. With her two previous loans she has made improvements to her plantation and increased her yield of chayote. This time she has asked for a third loan of 6,000 lempiras for the continued upkeep of her crops. She will buy supplies such as fertilisers and fungicides. She remains motivated to carry on growing and improving her plantation.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas para el cultivo de pataste.

loans.name: Maria Reina

texts.es: María, tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y ella vive en el municipio de San Pedro sula con su familia. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la venta de productos de AVON, Arabella, Zelsa y victoria secrete, estos productos son cremas, champú, tratamiento para el cabello, perfumes, desodorantes y maquillajes. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida pero le ha gustado más la venta de cosméticos, en este ya tiene 19 años de experiencia. Ella vende en su casa y también ambulante según pedidos. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por  14,000 Lempiras, el cual lo invertirá para la compra de las cajas de la mercadería al por mayor y de contado. Su plan es tener capital de trabajo para no comprar al crédito y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the city of San Pedro Sula with her family. She has been selling Avon, Arabella, Zelsa and Victoria’s Secret products for many years. The products she sells include creams, shampoo, hair treatments, perfumes, deodorants and make up. Previously she sold food, but she likes selling cosmetics more and has 19 years experience in this area. She sells from home and also makes visits to her customers, depending on the order. She is requesting a loan for 14,000 Lempiras which she will invest in the purchasing boxes of merchandise at wholesale. Her plan is to have enough capital so that she does not have to buy merchandise on credit and she can continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise from Avon, Arabella, Zelsa and Victoria's Secret to sell.

loans.name: María Del Rocio

texts.es: gracias al crédito otorgado por kiva el ciclo pasado María pudo comprar planta para resembrar parte de su finca donde tenia muchas plantas viejas y realizar el pago a los jornaleros que le ayudaron en la limpia de su finca, para estos nuevos créditos María pide un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes que le ayudaran a que sus plantas nuevas crezcan y las que ya están produciendo aumente considerablemente y para el pago de jornaleros que le ayudaran en la limpieza de su finca y la poda para que en la temporada de cosecha este en optimas condiciones.
texts.en: Thanks to her previous Kiva loan, María was able to buy plants to re-seed part of her farm where she had a lot of old plants, and she was also able to hire labourers to help clean up her farm. She is asking for this loan to buy fertilisers which will help the new plants to grow and increase the output of those which are already producing. She will also be able to hire more labourers to help with the cleaning up and pruning of her farm so that when harvest comes it will be in optimal condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and hire labourers to help her clean up her farm.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 56-year-old married man.  He is a father of three children and he has worked as a butcher since 2006. He is multitasks in order to make sure he can provide his family with the necessities of life. George also works as a school bus driver, has a bakery, and works in construction, specializing in cement work. All of these businesses were established to cover his family's increasing expenses.

Today George is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a special meat mincing machine, a specialized "Kibbeh" making machine (Kibbeh is a delicious, traditional Lebanese food), an odor-expelling machine, and an aluminum separator. These items will improve his business a lot and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a special meat mincing machine, a specialized kibbeh making machine, an odor-expelling machine, and an aluminum separator

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 53 years old, from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and her husband finds his source of livelihood through fishing. Ma. Delia sells whatever her husband catches and she also buys fish from other fishermen in the community. In addition, she owns and operates a sari-sari store. 

Ma. Delia is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to be used as additional capital to buy more fresh fish and shells. With her hard work, Ma. Delia is optimistic of her plan for improvements in her business. 

In the future, she hopes to make her sari-sari store bigger for increased profits.

loans.use: to buy shells and fresh fish.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children ages 14, 16, and 18. Ursula has benn engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for a long time now. In her store, she sell items like vinegar, soy sauce, noodles, canned goods, and snacks. She works hard for her three children so she can provide for them. 

Ursula is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of sugar, soy sauce, cooking oil, chips, candies, and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to maintain a better inventory so she can have good sales on a daily basis. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store for better business profitability and to send her children to school for a better future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soy sauce, cooking oil, chips, candies, and toiletries

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a Kiva borrower and is 56 years old. She is married and has four children. She describes herself as determined. Veronicah does tailoring of clothes and selling clothes to earn an income.

Veronicah has taken a loan of KES 30,000 to buy a solar panel that will benefit six family members. This will enable them have lighting at a cheaper cost with no monthly bills. They do not have electricity. This is Veronicah's third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
JOSE tiene 23 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa con los padres en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC LA PAULINA, se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Recinto la Paulina, Pertenece al Cantón Pueblo Viejo se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

JOSE  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abonos, insecticidas, abono orgánico.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras. Las compras y ventas lo hace  en la ciudad de Ventanas.

El sueño es comprarce una moto. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es sembrar una cuadra de cacao. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor con los amigos.
texts.en:
Jose, 23, is single and does not have any children. He lives with his parents in Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. The lending club La Paulina is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, in the zone of La Paulina. It belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo, where the people work in farming and cattle. Jose is a farmer, planting corn and rice. He asks for a loan to buy seeds, urea, manure, insecticides, and compost. With the help of the loan he will be able to buy the things he needs for planting. 
Jose makes his purchases and sales in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to buy a motorcycle. His challenge is planting a section of cacao. In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer with his friends.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, manure, insecticides and compost.

loans.name: Consuelo De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Consuelo es soltera no tiene hijos vive en San Jose de Chimbo vive con Familiares.

Se dedica al comercio de granos por ya hace muchos años, el credito lo solicita para comprar electrodomesticos para la casa ya que el que tenia esta muy viejo.

El sueño de Consuelo es tener buena salud para seguir trabajamdo y tener un bebe. En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a caminar con la sobrena que tiene 5 años.
texts.en: Consuelo is single and has no children; she lives with relatives in San José de Chimbo.  She has worked selling grains for many years now and is requesting the loan to buy home appliances for her home because the one she has is very old.  Consuelo’s dream is to be in good health in order to continue working and to have a baby.  She enjoys going for walks with her five-year-old niece in her free time.

loans.use: to buy appliances

loans.name: Ilaisa

texts.en: Ilaisa is a 48 woman who is divorced with 5 children. She has a small business, lawn mowing. To earn extra income, she also has an ice cake business. Ilaisa needs a loan to to buy foam cups, cool aid, sack of sugar, engine oil, carburetor parts and spark plugs. She will use her profits to help her family and her children's education. Ilaisa joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, cool aid, sack of sugar, engine oil, carburetor parts and spark plugs

loans.name: Jessica Del Socorro

texts.es: Jessica es una joven de 23 años de edad, habitante del barrio Hugo Chávez una zona muy vulnerable a las lluvias debido a que están a orillas del lago de Managua, tiene una relación pero su pareja tuvo que emigrar a otro país en busca de empleo, ella trabaja en contabilidad para una empresa privada, no tiene hijos aun, su deseo es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Este crédito lo destinara en comprar ventanas y portones para ponerlos en su casa, para garantizar la seguridad a la familia.
texts.en: Jessica is a 23 year-old youth who lives in the Hugo Chavez neighborhood.  This neighborhood is very vulnerable to the rains, because it is located on the banks of Lake Managua.  She is in a relationship, but her partner had to emigrate to another country to search for work.  Jessica works in accounting for a private company.  She does not yet have children.  She wants to be able to improve the condition of her house.  She will use this loan to buy windows and gates to put in her house, to ensure the safety of her family.

loans.use: to buy a gated door and windows for her house

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Teopista has business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Teopista doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She works in the market six days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her customers ability to reach her. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. Teopista resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is a businesswoman in El Paraiso, Sapang Dalaga. She is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children. To make a living, Lucila has a shop where she sells assorted groceries. She has been earning a monthly income of PHP 5000 and has operated her business for 5 years. Lucila has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase assorted groceries to sell. Lucila has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2005.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and beverages

loans.name: Kenia Azucena

texts.es: Kenia, de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive con ellos y su esposo en el municipio de la Masica Atlántida. Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace 3 años de un salón de belleza y venta de productos cosméticos. Ofrece a sus clientes, peinados, cortes de pelo, alisados, planchados, tintes, tratamiento de uñas etc. También vende productos como tintes, cremas, champú, glases, quita esmalte etc. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y es muy conocida en la comunidad. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 28,000 Lempiras para cubrir las compras al crédito y surtir mas su negocio de cremas, champú, tintes, esmaltes y otros productos que vende y usa en su salón. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para sacar adelante a su familia y poderle dar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos y poderlos graduar.
texts.en:
Kenia is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children.  She lives with her husband and children in the municipality of La Masica in the department of Atlántida.  

For 3 years, Kenia has had her own beauty salon and cosmetic sales business.  She offers her customers hairstyling, haircuts, straightening, ironing, hair color, and nail treatments, and other services. She also sells products like hair color, creams, shampoo, nail polish, and nail polish remover, etc. She has the business in her house, and she is very well-known in the community.

Kenia is requesting a second loan for 28,000 Honduran lempiras to pay for some purchases that she made on credit, and to stock her business with more creams, shampoos, dyes, nail polish, and other products that she uses and sells in her salon.  Her goal is to grow her business so that she can provide for her family and give her children a better quality of life and an education.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her salon and to payoff pending bills for prior credit purchases

loans.name: Saturno Walter

texts.es: El cliente es del sector de Guasmo en Guayaquil.  Empezó su negocio hace 6 años, ya que anteriormente laboraba en una empresa.  Montó este negocio, dado que tenía habilidades en este campo y actualmente está localizado en la parte exterior de su domicilio.  Es casado y tiene 2 hijos, vive con uno de ellos y además con su nuera.  Su esposa es ama de casa.  Desea a futuro poder ampliar su negocio y construir el segundo piso de su casa.  Ahora, necesita el dinero para la compra de material de cerrajería para su trabajo.
texts.en: This client is from the Guasmo sector in Guayaquil.  He started his business six years ago; prior to that he was employed in a firm.  He started the business because he had skills in this field and it’s currently located in the yard outside his house.  He’s married with two children; one of them and his daughter-in-law live with him.  His wife’s a housewife.  He hopes in future to expand the business and add a second story to his house.  Now, he needs money to buy metalworking supplies for his work.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Victor Tarquino

texts.es:
Victor tiene 47 años de edad es divorsiado vive con los padres en San Jose de Chimbo.

Victor tiene un tienda de abarrotes en donde vende productos de primera necesidad, solicita el credito para de un electrodomesticos (enfriador) para poner los embutidos y gaseosas.

Con el credito le apoyado para la compra del enfriador y que los productos no se dañe y no pierda.

El sueño es comprar un terreno para hacer una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta leer el periodico.
texts.en: Víctor, 47, is divorced living with his parents in San José de Chimbo.  He has a grocery store where he sells basic staples.  He requests the loan to buy appliances (refrigerator) to store the cured meats and soft-drinks.  With the loan he’ll be able to buy the refrigerator and be able to keep the products from being damaged and lost.  His dream is to buy a lot to build a house on and he enjoys reading the newspaper in his free time.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Phinoline

texts.fr: phinoline est une femme de 54 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants. elle gère un petit stand de vente de beignets dans un quartier de la ville depuis 15 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières (achat farine, sucre, poissons frais) afin de booster son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être injecter dans son capital aux besoins de sa dernière fille (éducation, nutrition)et d'elle même d'autre part.
texts.en: Phinoline is a 54-year-old woman, a widow, and mother of five. She has been running a small stand selling beignets in a neighborhood in the city for fifteen years. She is requesting this loan to bolster her stock of ingredients (flour, sugar, fresh fish) in order to boost her sales. The profits generated will add to her capital and [help meet] the needs of her youngest daughter (education, nutrition), as well as her own.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making beignets to sell

loans.name: Koshie's Group

texts.en:
This group has three members and is led by Koshie, as its representative. The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include selling groceries and cosmetics. They will need a total amount of GHS 3900 to expand their businesses. The loan will benefit this group of micro-businesswomen, of which Koshie is a member.

Koshie says that she joined ID-Ghana four years ago and became a founding member of this group. This is her second loan request to Kiva, and fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. Koshie is standing in the middle in the photograph.

She currently has a business selling provisions and cosmetics. She started this business three years ago, on her own initiative. Before that, she was selling jeans. Koshie will use her part of this loan, GHS 1500, to increase her capital. She will buy items from the market, including body cream, hair cream, baby Pampers, and fruit drinks. She will sell them, by hawking to her customers. This work allows her to make an income for her family. Koshie is 30 years old, single, and has three children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Koshie replied that she likes the health insurance services and the training sessions. She says her loans have made it possible to take care of her children and her needs, by saving part of her profits and reinvestment of the other part, in her business.

loans.use: to buy items to resell by hawking, including body and hair creams, diapers, and fruit drinks

loans.name: Potofou

texts.en:
Potofou is a 50 year old married woman with one child. 
She is running a livestock business (pigs) to earn a living. Potofou has requested a loan to buy barbed wire, nails, pipes and to pay for  labour for building her (livestock shelter) pig sty.
She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Potofou will use her profits to support her family.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, nails, and pipes, and pay for labour

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: La señora Rosa, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo sueña con ver construida su casa, ella trabaja para una empresa de Limpieza y sus esposo tambien, entre los dos luchan dia a dia para lograr su sueño, con este credito comprara Materiales como: Bloques, Hierro, Cemento, etc. Agradece el apoyo y confianza que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kiva le estan brindado.
texts.en: Rosa lives with her husband in the municipality of Ticuantepe.  She dreams with seeing her house built completely.  She works for a cleaning firm and so does her husband.  The two of them strive daily to reach their dream and will use this loan to buy supplies like blocks, iron, cement, etc.  She is grateful for the support and trust Afodenic along with Kiva funds are providing her.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Hermes

texts.en:
Hermes earns a living with his barber shop in San Miguel, Bohol. He has been in the business for more than 3 years, and this is the source of his income. 

Hermes is asking for a loan to buy materials for the shop like hair coloring, scissors, brushes, powder, and alcohol. With these supplies, he hopes that he will be able to improve his business as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy materials for his shop

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is a 55-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He is engaged in tricycle transport services. He transports passengers from one place to another with a certain fee.

He requested a loan of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy motorcycle parts and pay for maintenance to avoid hassle. In the future, Celso would like to improve his tricycle transport services to improve his livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Joedemi

texts.en: Joedemi is 40 years old and lives in Labo Ozamiz City. She is married and has one adult and two school-age children. Joedemi has a retail business from which she earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month. She has applied for a loan to buy a one-unit motorcycle which will be used in the transport and delivery of purchased items. Joedemi has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Joedemi hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Revendeur de ciment à AGOE, une localité située au Nord de la ville de Lomé, Mr Kokou sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour s'approvisionner en marchandises. Il a démarré en 2008. Marié, il est père de famille de 04 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Le profit permettra à mr Kokou de rendre pérenne son activité et de permettre à la famille de s'épanouir.
texts.en: A retailer of cement in AGOE, a town located north of the city of Lomé, Mr. Kokou is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise (cement). He began in 2008. He is a married father of four children, of whom two are in school. The profits will enable Mr. Kokou to make his business sustainable and allow his family to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase cement to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Letecia. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Letecia's hope is for her business to grow bigger and to have a better living. Letecia meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizers to be used in her business.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is 35 years old, married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Habiba has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Habiba requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to make dried fish.

Habiba has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Habiba would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Note: she is a Muslim in religion and covering their face is part of her culture.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as T-shirts, blouses, shorts, pants and other items. She is happy that TRM offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, blouses, shorts, pants and other items.

loans.name: Abdulqader

texts.en:
Abdulqader is 25 years old. He lives in Amman, Jordan. He has one sister. Abdulqader is a third-year student, studying for a Bachelor of Mobile Systems Management. He also works in the Education Ministry. One of the obstacles that Abdulqader has faced is the increase of his study fees. Now, he is seeking a loan to pay his study fees.

 He is planning to expand his study and get a higher degree, in the future.

loans.use: To pay his study fees

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’ Agoé qui est un quartier au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la restauration (cafétariat). Elle exerce ce commerce dans une boutique. Le stock dont elle dispose présentement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un quatrième crédit pour acheter des boites de lait, de sucre, des œufs... Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en: This is a married woman and mother of three. She lives with her family in a district in Agoé, which is located north of the city of Lomé. She has a restaurant (cafeteria), a revenue-generating business. She operates it in a shop. The stock of supplies she has at present does not allow her to satisfy her customers. She is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES to purchase containers of milk, sugar, eggs, …  She would like to expand her business and ensure her family's vital needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her cafeteria

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson is 47 years old and lives in San Pablo, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married with three children.

Jerson has a shop and a traveling rice mill from which he sells rice. He has had this business for 20 years. He requested a loan to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jerson has been a member of PMPC for almost two months. In the future, Jerson hopes to expand his business and his lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

location.town: Molave - San Pablo, Dumingag,  Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: 01.06.06 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Anh is applying for a loan to purchase household commodities in general to resell. She has a retail business selling general things. Anh is 37 years old and she is married with two children. Anh is the group leader of the 01.06.06 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2011, Anh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Anh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Anh has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Anh faces in her business is lack of capital.

Using her business profit, Anh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase  household commodities in general to resell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz, 60 years of age, married and blessed with seven children, has owned and managed a corn farming business for almost 20 years. The most recent harvest yielded her a net income of Php 40,000. 

Luz is now requesting a loan of Php 22,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. She is hoping that her request will be granted so that she can earn more profits to improve her agricultural business.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 56 years old, married and has worked as a tailor for many years. She enjoys her business a lot. Though she is already old, still she has been able to manage her business and has raised her children through it. 

Trinidad plans to have her own tailoring shop someday where she can display all her tailored curtains, unlike now. Now she only brings her samples to the market, and there she sells her finished products to have sales. 

She is highly motivated to improve her enterprise in order to increase her income. Thus, Trinidad is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy needles, thread and material to make curtains to sell. She hopes to make her dream come true through her hard work and patience in managing her business.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread and material to make curtains to sell.

loans.name: Jeason

texts.en: Jeason is single and lives in Molatuhan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. His parents earn a living from farming, and he helped them by working on the farm on weekends. Despite the financial hindrance, Jeason is still going to pursue his dream of finishing his studies. He took a loan from Gata Daku MPC to cover the costs of school tuition and study materials. He hopes that after this, he will be able to work in any company related to his course.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school tuition and materials

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: La cliente corresponde al sector de Suburbio en Guayaquil.  Empezó años atrás vendiendo confitería de manera ambulante, en donde le fue muy bien.  Luego de esto, montó una tienda y además se dedicó a vender lotería y ya lleva realizándolo por 15 años.  Ahora cuenta con una buena clientela que le compran diaria o semanalmente.  Distribuye su labor en la mañana vendiendo lotería y en la tarde atendiendo el negocio de la tienda con la ayuda de sus hijos.  Es separada desde hace 13 años y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 13 años; quienes estudian en el establecimiento fiscal.  Ahora necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en lotería y artículos/víveres para su tienda.
texts.en: This client is from the Suburbio sector of Guayaquil.  She started years ago selling snacks from place to place and did very well.  After this, she set up a store and also sold lottery tickets and has been doing this for 15 years.  She now has a good clientele that buy from her daily or weekly.  She spends mornings selling lottery tickets and afternoons tending to the store with help from her children.  She’s been separated for the last 13 years and has three children who are 18, 15 and 13 years of age who attend local public schools.  She needs a loan now to buy lottery tickets and stock merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets and stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Durante el año pasado Gonzalo resembro media hectárea de café gracias a un crédito obtenido de Kiva. Estas nuevas plantas estarán dando sus primeros frutos en dos años y así podrá aumentar su producción. Para esta cosecha nuevamente solicita un financiamiento pues necesita comprar fertilizantes y realizar algunas labores de limpieza en su finca. Al final de la cosecha con las ganancias obtenidas pagará este crédito.
texts.en:
In the past year Gonzalo replanted half an acre of coffee thanks to the Kiva loan he got.  These new plants should start producing their first fruit in two years and he’ll be able to increase production then.  

For this new crop he’s once again asking for financing because he needs to buy fertilizer and do some weed clearing on his farm.  He will repay the loan with profits earned at the end from the sale of his harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to clear weeds.

loans.name: Gerson Javier

texts.es:
Gerson, vive con su familia en casa propia, su esposa y su hija, asimismo con un hermano mayor. El, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz, lo hace desde hace mucho tiempo atrás y desde cuando era pequeño, ya que su padre le inculco el oficio. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a seguir creciendo el inventario y obtener mejores resultados, asimismo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Su sueño es hacerle mejoras a su vivienda para vivir mas confortable.
texts.en:
Gerson lives with his family, his wife and daughter, as well as an older brother, in his own home. He makes a living through agriculture. He sows corn. He has done so for many years and since he was little, since his father instilled the profession in him.

The loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy necessary agricultural supplies, such as: fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, seeds, among others. This loan will allow him to continue growing the inventory and obtain better results, and additionally improve his family’s quality of life.

His dream is to improve his home to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide, seeds, among others.

loans.name: Creatifa Group

texts.en:
Rosalina is one the members from Greatifa Group and the word "Greatifa" is in a lokal language, 
that means" Hope"
She is taking the loan to add more her own working capital in order to buy some additional supplies such as flowers and wood.she is a hard working woman. she started her business a year ago with her own working capital of $ 60.00 dollars.

loans.use: to buy flowers and wood

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es: Don Silvio es habitante del barrio Laureles Sur, una zona marginal de Managua, su esposa hace tortillas en la casa y las vende, el siempre con su labor como guara de seguridad, de esta manera apoyan a sus hijos que son adolecentes y continúan estudiando. Este crédito que solicita don Silvio es para instalar servicios higiénicos y empezar a  hacer un anexo a la casa, de esta manera espera ir poco a poco haciéndole las mejoras a su vivienda para el bienestar de su familia y sobre todo tener higiene en el hogar.
texts.en:
Silvio is a resident of the Laureles Sur neighborhood, a peripheral district of Managua. His wife makes tortillas at home and sells them. He works as a security guard. In this way, they support their children, who are adolescents and continue studying.

This loan that Silvio is requesting is to install a bathroom and begin to make an annex to the house. In this way, he hopes to go little by little making improvements to his home for the well-being of his family, and above all to have hygiene in the home.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, cement blocks, sand, and a toilet.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 32, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alex, an employee, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
 
Susan operates a food stall. She sells snacks like banana cue. Banana cue is a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Banana cue is made from Saba bananas. It is usually skewered on a bamboo stick, and is sold on the streets. She also sells different juices like gelatin juice and coconut juice. She is also a coconut dealer.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 3000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more coconut, bananas and other ingredients needed in her food stall.

Susan hopes to have more stalls and dreams of having a vacation with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more coconut, bananas and other ingredients needed in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married and has five children.  She operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various items to the people in her neighborhood. 

Lorna is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more stocks of canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, and cooking ingredients. With this loan, Lorna can expand the diversity of items at her store thus attracting more customers and buyers.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, snack foods, and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a turmeric tea business in the Philippines.

Levy requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials like sugar, turmeric, ginger, plastic for packing etc..
.
Levy has been in this business for 5 years now and earn additional income from farming sugarcane.

In the future, Levy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials like sugar, turmeric, ginger, plastic for packing etc..

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Marilyn has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid off her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She decided to change her business because these new businesses can earn a bigger income to sustain the needs of her family but she will be engage again in her previous businesses if she can find that can generate income not losses for her family.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials

loans.name: Jatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Jatu, from Waterloo, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with two children between the ages of three and eight years old. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2007, Jatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of sufficient capital to run her business.

Jatu requires a loan in order to buy more varieties of clothing material, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Jatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of clothing material, to expand her business.

loans.name: Everardo

texts.es: gracias al crédito otorgado por kiva en la cosecha pasada Everardo pudo aumentar su producción ya que compro fertilizantes que le ayudaron a que sus plantas aumentaran su producción y al pago de jornaleros que le ayudaron en la limpia y poda de su finca para que estuviera en optimas condiciones para la temporada de cosecha,en esta nueva etapa Everardo pide un crédito para la compra de planta ya que desea reforestar parte de su finca y así en unos años mas aumentar su producción lo cual le dejara buenas ganancias económicas y lograra en un futuro su sueño que es el de apoyar a sus hijos a terminar una carrera universitaria y tengan mayores oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Thanks to the loan provided by Kiva for the last harvest, Everardo was able to boost his production. He was able to buy fertilizers, which helped him make his plants more productive. It also helped him pay laborers, who assisted him with cleaning and pruning his farm so that it will be in good shape for the next harvest. 

In this new phase, Everardo is seeking a loan for the purchase of coffee plants because he wants to replant part of his farm, so that in a few years he will be able to increase his production. This will leave him good financial earnings and allow him to succeed in the future. His dream is to support his children so that they can complete university degrees and have more opportunities to grow.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants to replant part of his farm.

loans.name: Edgar Omar

texts.es:
Edgar, tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su familia que la conforma su esposa de 40 años de edad  y sus dos hijos. Edgar, se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de pipián y maíz, oficio que lo aprendió con sus padres, ya que el manifiesta que desde pequeño el acompañaba a sus padres al campo.
El préstamo que solicita lo utilizara para compra de insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas y de esa manera poder preparar la tierra para que su cultivo sea muy productivo y obtener una buena cosecha, asimismo de esta forma  poder obtener y gozar de muy buenos ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es fortalecer mas el negocio y  brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Edgar, 41, lives with his family consisting of his 40-year-old wife and their two children.  Edgar works in agriculture, specifically growing pumpkins and corn; an occupation he learned from his parents since he relates that he accompanied his parents in the fields when since he was little.

The loan he’s asking for will be used to buy agricultural supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, insecticide and fungicide in order to prepare the soil so that his crop will be productive and crop yield will be good.  Similarly, in this way he will be able to earn and enjoy very good income too.  His greatest dream is to strengthen the business more and to provide his family group with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rafelly

texts.en:
Rafelly is a prospective student of the Nusantara Maritime Academy. The program he will take is the Management Commerce and Harbour Administration. Rafelly wants to become an expert in the field of shipping and administration so he can work in the port. Rafelly is the first child of four siblings from the island of Batam. Batam Island, including the island provinces; namely Riau Islands, is located on the west side of Indonesia. His father works as a self-employed labourer with no fixed income. Rafelly hopes to obtain a loan from Kiva investors. He wants to finish his education with no problems so he can ease the burden on his parents who finance his life. He wants to quickly get a job in order to finance schooling for his two sisters and one brother.

Rafelly is very grateful to Kiva investors who help finance his studies.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Agustinus

texts.en:
Agustinus desires to go to school - so he hopes - but, due to the condition of his poor parents, Agustinus has concerns. Agustinus lives in the Aru Islands, specifically in the town of Dobo, Ambon, Maluku. Both his parents work as farmers. Their income is erratic and only enough for everyday living expenses. So far, Agustinus has helped his parents. He is the third of three siblings. Agustinus is currently one of the students who will be studying at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He chose the Commerce program, Harbour Management and Administration, because, with his ability and his ideals, he can work in the office of the National Transportation Agency. Because he does not want to burden his parents, Agustinus applied for a loan to Kiva to cover the cost of his studies.

Agustinus is very grateful to the lenders who will help him with his studies, although not known to him.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Daud

texts.en: Commercial Shipping and Harbor Management is the study program selected by Daud. Currently he is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN) in Cilacap. He is eager to work in a shipping company or at a major port in Indonesia. Daud's parents are very supportive and eager to help Daud complete his education. Daud's father is only a farmer, whose income is uncertain. Sometimes, to meet daily needs, Daud must borrow from neighbors or relatives of his parents. Daud is the second child of two siblings. His sister helps his father to farm the fields. Daud hopes to obtain a student loan from Kiva to ease the burden on his parents. Daud thanks lenders around the world, although not personally know to him.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
For most people in Rwanda, electricity is a luxury.  Seated just south of the equator, the Rwandan sky is pitch-black each evening at 6pm, and seeing lights glowing from inside a home is a rarity. 

In Rwanda, just 11% of people have access to electricity, which means 8 million rural households use smoky, asthma-inducing and inefficient kerosene to light their homes. Without access to reliable energy, children often walk for hours to gather firewood instead of attending school, and adults lack reliable ways to charge the phones that keep them in touch with family or the market. Light for homework becomes prohibitively expensive, and rural hospital power outages put lives in danger. 

Rwanda-based Great Lakes Energy (GLE) provides low-cost and environmentally friendly solar energy products that bring electricity to those most in need, but they need your support to improve their reach to the most vulnerable.  

Founded by Sam, an American who has been living in Rwanda for the past decade, GLE and its team of Rwandans provides clean electricity to rural consumers, healthcare centers, orphanages and schools throughout Rwanda. 

Currently, the team runs its Rwanda-wide operations using outdated paper systems and a few old computers.  Up until now, GLE has focused its investments solely on its solar products, improving technologies to drive down costs for their consumers.  However, with outdated systems and IT equipment, GLE is struggling to keep up with existing clients and meet the demands of new clients in the larger market.

Right now, when the team installs solar panels at rural hospitals to give doctors access to stable light to perform examinations and patients access to life-saving machines, they plan installations on paper drawings and schedules because their computers are too unreliable to take to the field.  Detailed records are extremely difficult to maintain, risking missing vital maintenance checks, which can derail the promise of the solar light.  With extra time spent keeping paper records, they are diverting key resources away from spreading access to electricity.  

GLE is looking for new funding to purchase much needed IT equipment. This will allow the team to use engineering tablets and notepads to produce real-time drawings and electrical specifications. This increased efficiency will allow GLE to help more Rwandans access power, hire more local labor, and serve their customers more efficiently and accurately.  

This business innovation has real impact on people’s lives: supporting GLE means supporting more rural Rwandan families to tap into the benefits of electricity that are still out of reach for too many.   With solar, health improves.  Education improves.  Rwandans save several days of earnings each month on not purchasing CO2-emitting kerosene. 

But more than anything else, individual families can access the means to create better lives for themselves and their children.

loans.use: To purchase updated IT equipment so that this solar company can better service and access rural customers

loans.name: Masyurianto

texts.en:
Gets large orders, Masyurianto re-applying for loans to MUK. With new loan of 5M IDR, Masyuarianto will buy wood, cement, brick, stone and other necessities to build a house like nails, saws, hammers and others. He buy all that materials and sell it again to his customers who build a house. He take the materials from a large store and escort it to his customers. He will get directly payment.
With pursue this business, Masyurianto hoping to get satisfactory results. He could meet the needs of the family and he has a plan to buy a better car to support his efforts. To support the plan, all profits will be save.

loans.use: to buy wood, cement, brick, stone and other necessities to build a house like nails, saws, hammers and others

loans.name: Taiana

texts.en:
Taiana is 45 years old and married with six children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbages, tomatoes, and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for  two years. 

Taiana  needs a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush-knives, a file, fertilizer, gloves and boots. She became a member of SPBD in 2013. Taiana will use the profits from her sales to renovate her house and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush-knives, a file, fertilizer, gloves and boots

loans.name: Mayela Suyen

texts.es: La señora Mayela, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos, sus planes a futuro es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el esposo de doña Mayela tiene un taller de Refrigeracion y ella vende frutas y verduras, con este credito compraran materiales para realizar un cuarto donde puedan tener el taller ya que esta al aire libre y ellos desena tener mayor suguridad, ya que temen que se les lleven algun repuesto, comprara: Cemento, Bloques, Hierro, Arena, Piedrin, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Mayela lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children.  Her future plan is to be able to improve her living conditions.  Mayela’s husband has a refrigerator repair shop and she sells fruit and vegetables.

They will use this loan to buy building supplies to build a room where they can install the workshop because it’s currently open-air and they want to have more security because they fear having replacement parts stolen.  She will buy cement, blocks, iron, sand, gravel, etc.  She is grateful for the support Afodenic and Kiva funds have provided her to date.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Doña Raquel habitante del barrio Laureles Sur, su esposo se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, ahora ella tiene otro integrante más de la familia un hijo de 8 meses de nacido. Solicita el crédito para hacer instalación nueva del sistema eléctrico de su casa para el ahorro de energía, pondrá bujías ahorrativas con el objetivo de disminuir los gastos del hogar y esta es la manera de empezar a hacerlo para Raquel. Quedando pendientes aun varias mejoras como repello de paredes, piso, entre otros que hará poco a poco debido a sus bajos recursos económicos que le genera su empleo como docente de secundaria.
texts.en: Raquel lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood.  Her husband works selling home appliances and the family has a new member, an 8-month-old son.  She’s requesting the loan to install new electric wiring at home to save on electricity costs.  She will install energy-saving light bulbs in order to reduce household costs and this is how Raquel intends to start doing so.  There are still some other things pending like plastering the walls and installing flooring, among others but she’ll do those little by little due to the low economic resources she earns as a secondary school teacher.

loans.use: to buy electrical wiring, breakers, plugs, accessories and light bulbs.

loans.name: Nedilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, two of whom are in school, Nedilyn works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells peanuts in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nedilyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell for her business.

Nedilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 38 years old and married. Criselda has four children who are all in school.

Criselda is in the agricultural business. She raises pigs in the Philippines. Criselda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Criselda has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Criselda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, chips, noodles, etc.. Luzviminda has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from food vending, buy and sell charcoal and selling bamboo. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Avito

texts.en:
Avito is a fish and other seafood products vendor from the town of Panglao, Bohol. He is a married man and has three children ages 11, 10 and 9. Avito has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.

Avito is asking for a loan to buy more fish and other seafood products to sell. With this, he will be able to improve his sales as well as his income. Moreover, Avito dreams of becoming a successful businessman someday. He added that he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other seafood products to sell

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is from Ashotavan village of Syuniq region, where she lives with her husband and school-aged son. The region where the family lives is famous for its severe climate, so locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding and some land cultivation. Alisa has been involved in agriculture for many years. She raises cattle, keeps five colonies of bees, and cultivates several kinds of fruits and vegetables (potato, apple, plum, and pear). Alisa's only income comes from agriculture, so the farming business is very important for her and her family.

Now, this hardworking woman with a great credit history behind her is requesting a loan. She needs the loan for purchasing 10 colonies of bees, some calves, and fuel for transporting the harvest to the market. Alisa wants to increase the production of honey, and for that she needs to increase the number of bee colonies. Implementation of these goals is very important, for her to enlarge her farm and make her family's life better.

loans.use: to pay for 10 colonies of bees, some calves, and fuel for transporting the harvest to the market

loans.name: Samiya

texts.en:
Samiya is a seamstress from Shaab. She has a business providing sewing and alteration services. When Samiya has specialty jobs, or several jobs at once, she currently rents sewing machines. Having her own machines would enable Samiya to handle more customers and complete the work more quickly.

Samiya needs this loan to enable her to buy specialized sewing machines. She wants to open a shop located outside her home one day, and she wants to be able to send her sons abroad to study.

loans.use: To buy specialized sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent land for growing sugar cane

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: debido al crédito otorgado por kiva en ciclo pasado Porfirio pudo comprar nuevas plantas para cambiar las plantas viejas que tenia y que ya no rendían en la producción de igual modo pudo arreglar su camioneta que es su herramienta de trabajo y le ayuda en tiempos de cosecha a trasladar su café desde su finca hasta el centro receptor de la Unión Regional. Para esta nueva etapa de crédito Porfirio solicita de nuevo para la compra de fertilizantes ya que necesita que sus plantas nuevas crezcan y empiecen a producir por que con las ganancias que esto le genere en este año emprenderá su negocio que es la cría de  cerdos ya que le dejara buenas ganancias económicas y con ello mejorara su calidad de vida y la de los suyos.
texts.en:
Thanks to the previous loan from Kiva, Porfirio was able to buy new plants to replace the old ones he had, which were not producing as much as they used to. He was also able to fix his van, which he uses as a working tool to transport coffee during the harvest from his land to the receiving center in the Regional Union.
For this new cycle, Porfirio is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer because he needs his new plants to grow and start producing. With the income this will generate, he will start a business raising pigs this year. This business will produce a good profit, which will allow Porfirio to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production.

loans.name: Octavianus

texts.en: Octavianus is a student who will study nautical courses on a campus of the Academy Maritime Nusantara. He comes from a small village located on the outskirts of the Kapuas River, the largest river in Kalimantan, precisely Sejiram village, Kapuas Hulu, West Kalimantan. Octavianus is the first of four children whose parents work as rubber farmers. Given that their economic conditions are not enough, Octavianus had no plans for college because of the uncertain income of his parents who have to fund studies for three as Octavianus and his sister are still in school. Octavianus hopes, by obtaining a loan from Kiva, he can continue his studies and his dream to be a professional sailor can be realized in order to make his parents and younger siblings happy Thanks from Octavianus to Kiva lenders who have made it easy for him to achieve a better future.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Aditya

texts.en:
His goal to become a sailor has been a dream of Aditya. He currently is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, with programs in Nautical science. However, the concern Aditya has is that he cannot achieve these ideals, as he's the first of four children. Due to economic factors hampering his  family, his father is employed as a construction worker in Jakarta, with a mediocre income and his mother does not have any special skills. With minimal income, Aditya's father has to feed four children and to pay the school fund. 

Aditya's parents make every effort to help Aditya achieve his desires and ideals. Through the Student Loan program from the Kiva, Aditya hopes to finish his education and get a job on a fast ship. He is very grateful to the lenders of Kiva, because thanks to their help, he can cover the cost of tuition and can continue his studies.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jenny Agustina

texts.es: Jenny habitante del barrio la fuente, una zona marginal de Managua, ella es  trabajadora busca como salir adelante junto a su familia, en la actualidad tiene a una hija a su cargo quien está estudiando. Ella continúa con su labor como docente junto con su esposo, siendo este el único medio de ingresos de los dos. El deseo de Jenny, aun con dificultades para caminar al sufrir un pequeño accidente en un transporte público, es poder construir un cuarto con baño para el bienestar de la familia, de esta manera irá mejorando las condiciones de su hogar, quedando pendientes afinar paredes mejoras del piso entre otros, que espera ir haciendolo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Jenny lives in the La Fuente neighborhood, a marginal zone in Managua.  She’s hardworking and seeks ways to get ahead alongside her family.  She currently has a daughter attending school that’s dependent on her.  She continues working as a teacher alongside her husband.  This is their only source of income.

Jenny hopes that even with the difficulties caused by a small traffic accident on public transportation that she will be able to build a room with a bath for her family’s well-being and in this way gradually improve her home’s conditions.  Pending will still be plastering walls and installing flooring, among others, that she hopes to be able to do little by little.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is 73 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela, Philippines. She is a widow and has one one child. Josefa has a store that sells personal products. She has had this business for five years. She applied for a loan to purchase additional personal products to sell, such as detergents and beauty products.
