Deogratius is aged 37 and married. He has seven children. Six of his children attend school, and he is in charge of paying the school fees. Deogratius operates a 'waragi' trade business as his major source of income. ('Waragi' is a local, distilled beverage, similar to gin.) He has been doing this work since 2002. Deogratius also practices agriculture, as an additional sources of income for the family.

He has approached UGAFODE for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings. He will use part of the loan to buy 'waragi,' and another part to pay workers to plough land, for maize growing in the coming season. His dream is to grow his business, to realize greater returns and also to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To buy local gin to resell, and to pay workers to plough land for growing maize

loans.name: Warakoze Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne  fait partie du groupe  Warakoze et habite à Kayanza. Elle a 56 ans et est mariée à  Jérôme, un commerçant.Ensemble ils ont7 enfants âgés de 14 à 30 ans dont 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de la bière de banane depuis 20 ans.

Elle est à son quatorzième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et beaucoup de bananes pour préparer une grande quantité de bière de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle  voudrait construire une maison et voir ses enfants continuer leurs études.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a member of the Warakoze group and lives in Kayanza. She is 56 years old and is married to Jerome, a merchant. Together they have seven children, aged 14 to 30, of whom one goes to school. 

Jeanne has been selling banana beer for 20 years. She is on her 14th loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy bananas to make a large quantity of banana beer, which she will resell to earn more. 

In the coming years, Jeanne would like to build a house and see her children continue with their studies.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas to make beer to sell

loans.name: Annie Yolande

texts.fr: Annie est une femme de 41 ans, marié et mère de 6 enfants. elle gère une petit comptoir-restaurant  dans un quartier de la ville depuis 4 ans où elle vend des repas camerounais. Dynamique, elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant du poisson, viande, riz. Ce qui permettra de satisfaire sa clientèle et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son capital d'une part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en:
Annie is a 41 year old woman, married and the mother of six children. She has been running a small restaurant counter in a district of the city for the past four years, where she sells Cameroonian meals.

An active merchant, she is requesting this loan to increase her stock of raw materials by purchasing fish, meat, and rice. This will allow her to satisfy her customers and increase her revenues. Part of the income she earns will be reinvested in her business, and the rest she will use to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (fish, meat, and rice).

loans.name: Sara Yaneth

texts.es:
Sara con una edad de 34 años se dedica a la agricultura es madre de 3 hijos con un grado de educación secundaria completa graduandoce como Bachiller en Ciencias y Letras. En compañía de su pareja trabajan la tierra en lo que es la siembra, poda, limpia, abono, fertilización, etc. del café. Sus tres hijos, uno ya se caso y dos dependen de ella, uno de 14 años que trabaja junto a su padre y el menor de 12 años que está estudiando en primer curso en el centro básico de la localidad. Fue en compañía de su compañero de hogar como aprendió a trabajar la tierra la cual esta aproximadamente a una hora de su casa de habitación al la cual se trasladan caminando ya que no tienen transporte propio. sus clientes son bodegas de lugares aledaños y los vecinos.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de insumos y mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café brindando una mayor seguridad a sus cultivos y haciéndolos mas atractivos para sus clientes.

Sus metas son que con el apoyo solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL ella pueda hacer crecer su negocio y pueda mejora su nivel de vida con las ganancias para re invertir en sus cultivos y así poder formar un mejor patrimonio a sus hijos ya que de esa manera ella podrá apoyarlos y que puedan tener un mejor nivel educativo y algo que ofrecer a sus futuros hijos.
texts.en:
Sara is 34 years old, and she makes a living farming coffee. She has three children, one of whom is married and grown up and two of whom still depend on her. Her two younger children are 14 years old and 12 years old. The 14-year-old helps with the family farming operation, and the 12-year-old is currently in school. Sara learned various farming techniques from her husband, and they now work together to plant, prune, clean, fertilize and water their land and coffee crops. Since they do not have a car, Sara and her husband have to walk an hour daily just to reach their coffee plants. When they have harvested the coffee beans, they sell them to nearby storehouses and neighbors.

With the support from this loan, Sara plans to purchase agricultural inputs for tending her coffee plants. She hopes that this investment will increase the health of her crops and allow her to offer higher quality coffee beans to clients. Her goals include expanding and strengthening her business and improving her family's quality of life. She plans to reinvest her profits in her farming operation in hopes of increasing the value of her land and crops for the benefit of her children and future generations.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural input items and tend her coffee plants.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    est constitué    de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans,  4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLA DIAGADA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur  troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide   est la spéculation cultivée par    DOUNAMBA      la1ére femme assise   dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  2 hectares. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 120 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
This group  is made up of married women with an average age of 35 and on average 4 children, all living in polygamous families in Kola Diagada, one of the villages of Bougouni, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their rainy season agricultural activities. They are on their third loan with the institution, the past loans having been correctly reimbursed.

Peanuts are the crop cultivated by Dounamba, first woman seated in the photo, right to left. With her loan, she intends to buy inputs and seeds and pay the plowing fees to cultivate two hectares. Her produce will be sold right in the village, at the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women.
 
She expects to make a profit of 120,000 F CFA each growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay plowing fees for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Filiton Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  FILITON II  est constitué  8  de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, 3  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à   ZAMBOUROULA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 9éme  prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’ arachide    est la spéculation cultivée de    MINATA     la 2éme femme debout       de la gauche vers la droite.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter de la semence pour exploiter  1hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de  45000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The group "FILITON II" is composed of eight married women, who average 33 years of age and 3 children each, all living in polygamous families in ZAMBOUROULA, a village in BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their rainy season farm work. They are on their ninth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

Peanuts is the crop grown by MINATA, who is the second woman standing from the left. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds to make use of 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village, at the market. She plans on making a profit of 45,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will enable her to pay back the loan and help her husband to cover the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and plowing for planting crops

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Durán.  Hace tiempo empezó a brindar servicios de transportes con una tricimoto que pudo adquirir.  Luego decidió venderla para comprarse un vehículo y empezar a laborar como taxista.  El realiza su trabajo solo, en 2 horarios (mañana y noche).  Es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Desea a futuro poder invertir en un vehículo nuevo para seguir con esta actividad.  Al momento necesita el préstamo para la compra de útiles escolares de su sobrina.
texts.en:
The client is from the city of Durán.  Some time ago he started to provide transportation services in a “tricimoto” [three wheeled motorized vehicle] that he was able to get.  He then decided to sell it in order to buy a vehicle and start working as a taxi driver.  He does his work alone on two schedules (morning and night).   He is single, and he has no children.

In the future he hopes to be able to invest in a new vehicle in order to be able to continue with this business activity.  He now needs a loan to buy school supplies for his niece.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his niece.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is a single mother of three. All her three children attend school and they depend on her for everything.  She sells charcoal to retail businesses in Malindi town.  She has been in this business for the last six years. Her charcoal sells quickly and she has four employees who help her run the business. She also deals in animal sales. 

The challenge in her business is police who are really corrupt. Transportation costs are also high. She learned about Milango through friends and she now seeks a loan to buy 20 bags of charcoal and firewood for sale. Income raised from the business will help her pay school fees for her children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Durán.  Aprendió esta actividad de su padres, quienes le enseñaron.  Trabaja todo el día atendiendo su local de comidas.  Es soltera pero tiene 1 hijo, de quien se hace cargo ella sola. Por ahora, necesita el dinero del préstamo para invertir en la compra de víveres para poder elaborar los desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas que vende en su restaurante.
texts.en:
The client lives in the city of Durán.  She learned this business activity from her parents, who taught it to her.  She works all day tending her eatery.  She is single, and she has one child for whom she alone is responsible.  

For now she needs the money from the loan to buy supplies in order to be able to make the breakfasts, lunches, and snacks that she sells at her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make the breakfasts, lunches, and snacks that she sells at her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizer

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old and lives in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options.  

Martha is married with four children aged between 28 and 17. Only two live at home and are currently attending school. The last grade she finished before getting down to business is grade 1. For the past ten years she has been selling rice, peppers, sugar, candy, tomatoes, etc. in the local market. 

Martha started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 7 am to 5 pm, and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, peppers, sugar, candy, tomatoes, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, sugar, candy, tomatoes, etc. for her business

loans.name: Michelle De Los Angeles

texts.es: La cliente vive en el sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un ingreso y por la falta de empleo.  Trabaja junto con su esposo de 8 am a 7 pm.  Ellos viven en estado de unión libre y se apoyan mutuamente.  Tienen una hija de 3 años.  Desea el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina de coser y tambien materia prima (ormas y suelas).
texts.en:
The client lives in the Fortín region of Guayaquil.  The business emerged out of the need to have income due to the lack of employment.  She works with her husband from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  They are in a common-law marriage, and they support each other.  They have a three year old daughter.

She wishes to have the loan to buy a sewing machine and raw material (lasts and soles).

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and raw material (lasts and soles).

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesús

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 47 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 7 hijos. Es un hombre dedicado totalmente a la agricultura; ya que siembra granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo, comenzó a trabajar desde que tenia 10 años de edad junto con su padre quien fue su tutor por mucho tiempo hasta que se acompaño con su actual señora, don Guadalupe quiere sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol para tener una buena alimentación de sus hijos y vender cuando tengan una necesidad.

Los insumos que utiliza para siembra de granos básicos como herbicidas, fertilizantes, insecticidas los  compra en la ciudad. Desde el lugar en donde vive hasta la ciudad, viaja en camión y tarda 1 hora ya que la calle esta en mal estado y desde la gruta le toca cargar en la espalda los insumos.

El dinero sera invertido en la compra de 2 litros de herbicida , 2 sacos de fertilizante e insecticidas. Se le estará apoyando con el crédito para que pueda comprar los insumos agrícolas que necesitara para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol y así pueda sacar su cosecha, que le permita brindar una alimentación saludable a sus hijos. 

Don Guadalupe quiere seguir cultivando como lo ha venido haciendo por mucho tiempo; ya que su pasión es trabajar la tierra.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 47 years old, in a relationship and has 7 children. He is completely dedicated to agriculture and grows basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum. He started to work when he was 10 years old, alongside his father, who was his tutor for a long time until Guadalupe met his partner.
Guadalupe wants to sow 7,000 square meters with beans so that his children can be properly fed and he can sell when the need arises.
He buys the supplies he needs to sow basic grains, such as herbicides, fertilizer and insecticide in the city. He travels from his home to the city by truck and it takes him one hour because the roads are in bad shape and he needs to carry the supplies from the side of the road on his back.
Guadalupe will invest the money in the purchase of 2 liters of herbicide, 2 sacks of fertilizer and insecticides. The support from this loan will allow him to buy the supplies to sow 7,000 square metres of beans and keep his crops going, which will allow him to provide a healthy nutrition for his children.
Guadalupe wants to keep farming like he has been for a long time, because his passion is to work the land.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Marbellí Del Socorro

texts.es: Marbellí es una mujer que busca como progresar en la vida, sus hijos van creciendo ya el mayor le ayuda a su padre a trabajar como tornero en un taller de mecánica, mientras que los otros dos se dedican de lleno al estudio. Marbellí continúa vendiendo cosméticos y ahora está experimentando el ser estilista. Ella solicita el crédito para construir un cuarto para el bienestar de sus hijos ya que en el espacio donde habitan es muy incomodo para todos, por lo que le es necesario hacer esta mejora en su hogar.
texts.en:
Marbellí is a woman who tries to find ways to get ahead in life.  Her children are growing up and the eldest already helps his father work as a lathe operator in a machine shop.  The other two devote themselves completely to their studies.  Marbellí continues selling cosmetics and currently she's experimenting with being a stylist.

She's requesting the loan to build a room for the welfare of her children.  The space where they live is very uncomfortable for everyone, so it's necessary to make this improvement in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, cinderblocks, corrugated metal sheets, and support beams

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es: Don Cesar, es un señor trabajador que poco a poco busca como salir adelante junto a su familia, hoy en día sus hijos estudian, el junto a su esposa le dedican el tiempo completo a la venta de fritangas comida típica, lentamente va haciéndole mejoras a su hogar para el beneficio de la familia. Este crédito que solicita es para construir un servicio higiénico e instalar pantry en su casa, esto con el objetivo de mejorar la higiene del hogar.
texts.en:
César's a hardworking man who little by little tries to find ways to get ahead with his family.  Currently his children are in school.  He and his wife work full-time selling traditional fried food.  Slowly he's making improvements to his home for the benefit of his family.

The loan he's requesting is to build a bathroom and install a pantry in his house.  His goal is to improve the hygiene of his home.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, a sink, and construction supplies

loans.name: Soway

texts.en:
Soway, 26 years old, operates a table selling used clothes in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water, and lots of transportation options. 

Soway is a unmarried mother with a two-year-old child, who is living at home with her. The last grade she finished before getting to business was grade 12. For the past three years she has been doing this business. She started this business with money given to her by her fiancee. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 9 am to 5 pm, and most of the time she uses a  shared taxi to get her goods to her spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 29 years old and lives in Montserrado County which has the highest production of fish on the Liberian market. She is married with four children between 13 and 1 year old. Only two are in school and all of them live at home. For the past seven years now, she has been operating a 'cook shop' (restaurant) which sells rice and soup in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, fish, meat, peppers, oil, charcoal, etc. for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, meat, peppers, oil, charcoal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel, a 41-year-old married father of two children aged 12 and 7, operates a drinking bar where he sells Sprite, Muscatela, fruit drinks, Malta Guinness, Coca-Cola, etc. everyday from 7 a.m. to 12 p.m. He has been in business for the past nine years.

Emmanuel wants to use this loan to purchase 15 crates of assorted soft drinks. A client of ID-Ghana for four years, this will be his seventh loan with them, and his second with Kiva.

Cynthia is 39 years old and sells men's and women's underwear. She is Emmanuel's wife.

loans.use: To purchase 15 crates of assorted soft drinks such as Sprite, fruit drinks, Malta Guinness, Coca-Cola, etc.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 65 años es casada tiene dos hijos vive con es esposo y con los hijos en San Jose de Chimbo Provincia de bolivar.

ella se dedica al comercio a la venta de granos secos commo son frejol, alverja y maiz. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de granos y cxocinas para vender.

El sueño es tener una lavadora ya que no puede seguir lavando la ropa de duele las manos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 65, is married and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children in Jose de Chimbo in the Bolivar province.  She sells dried produce like beans, peas, and corn.

She is requesting the loan to buy grains and cookery to sell.

Her dream is to have a washer because she is not able to continue washing the clothes because her hands hurt.

In her free time she likes to go out walking.

loans.use: to buy grains and cookery to sell.

loans.name: Precelia

texts.en:
Please do meet 40 year old Precelia from Liberia. She operates a table business (a very basic food stall) which sells oil, rice, pepper, vita, etc. in the Paynesville South area of Liberia.  It is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia, and one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable rents, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. 

She is married, and her husband is a driver.  They have three children, between ages 10 and five.  All three of them are currently attending school and living at home.  She stopped her education in 7th grade, but she is good at managing her business.  She describes herself as a hard working woman.

Precelia has been in this table business since 2007.  She works nine hours a day, six days a week at her business.  Her greatest challenge is small income. She intends to use the loan to buy more oil, rice, pepper, vita, etc. for her business. She started her business with help from her husband.  She likes her business because it makes a profit.  In the future, she wants to build house.  

She wants to thank the lenders for supporting BRAC Liberia and its borrowers.

loans.use: to buy more oil, rice, pepper, vita, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Please meet 38-year-old Felecia from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Felecia completed 8th grade and is married.  Her husband is a pastor.  She has three children between the ages of 17 and 10. Her three children are in school and they all live at home. 

Felecia has owned her own 'table business' (a small food stall) selling milk, eggs, soft drinks, etc. for the past four years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase milk, eggs, soft drinks, etc.  

On average, she works 7 hours a day at her business.  She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit.  In the future, she would like to build a shop. 
 
She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase milk, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Elena Beatriz

texts.es:
Elena es casada tiene dos hijos vive en San Jose de Chimbo tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos.

Elena se dedica a la venta del mejor plato tipico de la Provincia Como es el HORNADO.

El dinero lo solicita para la compra de cerdos ya que el hornado chimbelo se hace con a base de cerdo.

El sueño de Elena es estudiar la universidad.

en los tiempos liubres le gusta leer
texts.en:
Elena is married and lives in San Jose de Chimbo with her husband and three children. She makes a living cooking and selling a well known regional food dish known as hornado. 

Since hornado is a pork-based dish, Elena plans to use the support from this loan to purchase cuts of pork meat for her business. Her dream is to one day study at a university, and in her free time, Elena likes to read.

loans.use: to purchase cuts of pork to stock her food business.

loans.name: Cristo Nos Guia Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cristo nos Guía está conformado por diez integrantes, madres solteras con  15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad.  Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Son originarias del  Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. En sus ratos libre les gusta disfrutar en familia, le preparan platos típicos de la región como  el  “Nacatamal”  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Por lo tanto luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

La coordinadora del banco comunal es Martha y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, jugos, detergentes, gaseosas, tiste, huevos fósforos, en cantidades pequeñas. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos.Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El banco comunal  Cristo Nos guía agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Cristo Nos Guía Communal Bank is made up of 10 members, single mothers with 15 children in their care.  These women are known for being hardworking and responsible with a desire for personal improvement.  They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country.  In their free time they enjoy being with their families and like to make traditional regional dishes such as "nacatamales" [Nicaraguan-style tamales].  Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources, they had to work from a young age and weren't able to pursue an education.  They strive every day, however, to give their children a better future.

The coordinator of the communal bank is Martha, whose job is a "pulpería" located in her home.  A pulpería is a small store that sells food products in small quantities: rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, juice, detergent, soda, "tiste" [a corn and cocoa drink], eggs, and matches.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling products.  She works in her business some 12 hours a day, selling her products with great enthusiasm.

Cristo Nos Guía Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they have the means to a decent job.

loans.use: to stock her business with food products

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa, 42 years old and from Liberia, lives in St. Paul, a suburb located outside Monrovia, past Freeport. It has one of the oldest markets in the country and is known for its fresh fish, as it is located by the ocean. However, it is also one of the poorer areas of the country, and housing quality is often very low.

Theresa is a single mother of three children between 25 and 18 years of age. Two live at home and one goes to school. Theresa has a table business selling flour by the cup, an enterprise she started with money from her mother. She transports her goods by taxi. In business for five years, she works nine hours daily. One of her greatest challenges is low income.

With this loan, Theresa will buy more flour to resell. Proud of her business because it provides income, she plans to build a house. Theresa would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy flour to resell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
This is 30 year old Cecelia from Liberia. She lives in St. Paul, a suburb located outside Monrovia, past the Freeport.  It has one of the oldest markets in the country, and is known for fresh fish, as it is located by the ocean.  However, it is also one of the poorer areas, and housing quality is often very low. 

She is married with two children.  Her first child is 13 and her second child is 2.  They live at home, and the older child attends school. 

Cecelia has a table business in which she sells red oil from a table.  She has been in business for five years and works nine hour days.  With this loan, she will buy more red oil for her business.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income.  She transports her goods by taxi.  

She started her business with money from her savings.  She is proud of her business because she makes a profit. Her plan is to build a house.  She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: she will buy more red oil for her business.

loans.name: María Carmita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad, está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace muchos años tiene un hijo el cual ya está casado y vive con ella junto a su esposa y a dos hijos menores.

Doña María tiene una heladería en su casa  donde vende helados de la marca Pingüino, así como sodas y varios bocadillos de picar para satisfacción de sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, lleva en este negocio por 22 años y fue una de las primeras que puso este tipo de negocio en su localidad y es así como pudo salir adelante sola y darle lo mejor a su hijo para que pueda ser un hombre de bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar helados, sodas y bocadillos de picar. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the parish of Portoviejo, the members of the Communal Bank "Crucita" or "The Crossing" meet.  This town is known for its beautiful beaches that line the pretty locale and that are often visited by national and international tourists.  It is known by the name "Crucita la Bella" or "Beautiful Crossing."

María lives in this beautiful place.  She is 53 years old and is single, but she has a son from a previous relationship who is married and lives with her along with his wife and two minor children.

María has an ice cream shop in her home where she sells ice cream from the brand "Pinguino," or Penguin.  She also sells sodas and sandwiches for snacks in order to satisfy her customers.  She works every day from 8am until 8pm, and has been in the business for 22 years.  She was one of the first to begin this type of business in her town and thus she was able to get ahead alone and to offer the best to her son so that he could become a good man.

This loan is to buy ice cream, sodas and sandwiches for snacks.  María has been in the Communal Bank from the beginning and she likes it for the help that they always offer via loans. 
 
Her dreams are to continue working and to have good health.

loans.use: To purchase ice cream, sodas and sandwiches.

loans.name: Unidas Para Alcanzar El Exito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Ventura es miembro del grupo Unidas para Alcanzar el Éxito
Esta alcancía está entrando a su séptimo ciclo, lo conforman 09 socios. La Sra. Ventura de  53 años es casada y tiene 07 hijos todos mayores. Ella es la secretaria del grupo y desempeña su cargo responsablemente. Ella tiene un negocio de comidas en su casa por las mañanas vende ceviche y por las tardes anticuchos, semanalmente trabaja 70 horas, empezó este negocio hace 02 años gracias a una prima que la ánimo a trabajar vendiendo comidas, la ayuda de sus hijos ha sido muy importante, se siente feliz porque su negocio le ha permitido brindarle a sus hijos estabilidad económica y apoyarlos en sus estudios. Este préstamo le servirá para comprar mobiliario para su restaurante mesas y sillas que le hacen mucha falta, mas adelante le gustaría tener un local más grande para abrir un restaurante.
La sra.Ventura quiere decirle a los inversionistas de KIVA ¡Muchas gracias! en la foto esta con chompa y chaleco rojo.
*se juntaron 2 fotos porque algunos se retiraron temprano del desembolso.
texts.en:
Ventura is a member of the Unidas para Alcanzar el Éxito [United to Reach Success] group. The group is entering its seventh loan cycle and is made up of nine members. Ventura is 53, married, and has seven adult children. She is the group secretary and is very responsible in her post. She has a restaurant, run from her home. In the mornings she sells ceviche, and in the afternoons she sells anticuchos. She works 70 hours per week and started this business two years ago thanks to a cousin who encouraged her to start selling food. Her children's help has been very important. She is happy because her business has allowed her to offer her children economic stability and to support them in their studies. This loan will allow her to buy furniture for her restaurant. She will buy tables and chairs; she really needs these items. In the future she would like to have a larger space in which to open a restaurant.
Ventura thanks the Kiva lenders: "Thank you very much!".
In the photo, she is in the red sweater and vest.

There are two photos put together because some members left early from the disbursement.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her restaurant.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive la señora Noemí, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos, cuatro ya son  mayores de edad y el menor tiene 17 años y estudia en colegio. Su esposo comerciante.

Doña Noemí se dedica junto a su esposo al comercio, venden mariscos para lo cual muy temprano se van hasta las playas a comprar el mejor pescado para luego transportarlo en su carro hasta otras ciudades a realizar sus ventas, ellos entregan al por mayor y también al menudeo, trabajan cuatro días a la semana de cinco a seis horas al día. O hasta que se termine lo que compraron en el día.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón y otros mariscos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otras instituciones de crédito. 

Su sueño es tener un carro en mejor estado.
texts.en:
In the parish of Portoviejo the members of the Communal Bank "Crucita" or "The Crossing" meet.  The town is known for its beautiful beaches that line the pretty locale and that are often visited by national and foreign tourists. It is known by the name "Crucita la Bella" or "The Beautiful Crossing." 

Noemí lives in this town.  She is fifty years old and is married and has five children, four of whom are adults and the youngest who is 17 and studies in high school.  Her husband is a businessman.  

Noemí works along with her husband in business.  They sell seafood and for that reason very early go out to the beaches to buy the best fish in order to later transport it in their car to other cities to make their sales.  They sell in bulk and also retail, and they work four days a week between five and six hours per day or until they sell what they purchased that morning.

The loan is for purchasing fish, shrimp, and other seafood.  Noemí is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because the interest rates are very low in comparison to other institutions. 

Her dream is to have a car in better condition.

loans.use: To buy fish, shrimp, and other seafood.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: La señora Arminda es una persona joven y responsable, tiene dos hijos pequeños de dos y un año de edad, actualmente está viviendo en una humilde casa, se dedica a la actividad de la lechería,  desde que era pequeña comenzó la actividad de la lechería, ayudando a su madre, quien actualmente está al cuidado de la señora Arminda. La señora Arminda se siente agradecida por la enseñanza de su madre en la realización de esta actividad. La señora Arminda menciona que actualmente la actividad de la lechería es la principal fuente de ingresos de su familia. En lo posterior quiere trabajar también como enfermera ya que con su esfuerzo obtenido el título de técnico en enfermería. El crédito que solicita la señora Arminda es para la compra de alimento balanceado, ya que actualmente los precios de este insumo están aumentando, la señora Arminda al ver este efecto quiere almacenar este insumo y así reducir costos.
texts.en: Arminda is a responsible young woman and the mother of two young children of two and one.  She currently lives in a modest house.  She works in the dairy business, having begun at a young age by helping her mother, whom Arminda currently cares for.  Arminda is grateful for what her mother taught her about the business.  Arminda tells us that the dairy business is now the family's main source of income.  She eventually wants to work as a nurse, too, because she worked so hard to gain her clinic nurse qualification.  Arminda will use the loan she is applying for to buy nutritionally balanced food because the prices of these supplies are rising at the moment.  Having noticed this, Arminda wants to stock up on supplies and thereby reduce costs.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced food

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, a 38-year-old business woman from Liberia who describes herself as hard-working, is married and has three children between 12 and 4 years old, all currently attending school and living at home. She did not go to school.

Martha lives and works in St. Paul, which is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas that often finds its residents living in sub-standard housing.

For the past seven years, Martha has operated a table business which sells palm oil, rice, etc., an enterprise she started after selling for her mother. She works ten hours a day, and her greatest challenge is small income. She intends to use this loan to buy palm oil, rice, etc. for her business. She hopes to one day own a house.

Thank you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia!

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Javier Oswaldo

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 31 años, está casado con Vilma que tiene 28 años, tienen 1 hijo que nació hace 3 años, Javier vive con su familia en la casa de su suegro Jorge quien ha sido un gran apoyo para ellos y quien también se dedica a la agricultura. Ellos residen en Aláquez, parroquia del sector rural de Latacunga que guarda historia de varias culturas primitivas del Ecuador. En medio dl campo y el clima frío que se asienta en este lugar, se encuentran familias de campesinos que trabajan las tierras para sacar los mejores frutos de ellas. 
Javier aprendió la labor de a agricultura desde que era niño gracias a la instrucción de su madre quien le apoyó para que culmine la escuela primaria, y aunque a Javier le hubiese gustado continuar sus estudios, él se dedicó a las labores del campo con la esperanza de un día cumplir su sueño de tener su casa propia para que él y su familia puedan gozar de un lugar confortable donde vivir. 
Hace 5 años, este hombre trabajador decidió especializarse en la producción de papas, actividad a la cual le dedica 8 horas desde muy temprano cada día, para que con el cuidado minucioso que el preste a sus cultivos cada día, pueda resultar un producto de alta calidad y además no se echen a perder ninguna de las plantas, lo que lo librará de pérdidas y logrará la fidelidad de sus clientes. 
El cuidado especial que Javier le da al terreno y cultivos, requiere de algunos insumos como por ejemplo el abono que necesita comprar al por mayor para dar el tratamiento correcto a sus cultivos, para lo cual solicita un préstamo con el que logrará hacer esta compra y así avanzar con su labor la cual le da el sustento para su familia. 
Javier agradece el apoyo de quienes alrededor del mundo pueda aportar para que su negocio no se estanque y agradece a Fundación Alternativa por permitirle aplicar a un crédito mediante el producto de Kiva, lo cual lo motiva para seguir trabajando con esmero y dedicación y así no defraudar a quienes han creído en él.
texts.en: Javier is 31 years old and is married to Vilma, who is 28 years old.  They have one son who was born 3 years ago.  Javier lives with his family in the house of his father-in-law Jorge, who has been a great source of support for them and who also works in agriculture.  They live in Alaquez, a parish in the rural region of Latacunga which preserves the history of several of the original cultures of Ecuador.  In the middle of the countryside, in an area with a cool climate, are many farming families who work the land in order to grow the best possible fruit. Javier learned the work of agriculture when he was a child from his mother, who supported him through primary school.  Although Javier would have liked to continue with his education, he began working in the fields, with the dream of one day owning his own home where his family could enjoy a comfortable place to live.  Five years ago this hardworking man decided to specialize in the production of potatoes.  He works at this activity for 8 hours every day starting very early, so that the meticulous care that he devotes to his crops each day will result in a product of high quality without any loss of plants.  Thus he will avoid losses and ensure the loyalty of his customers. The special care that Javier provides to his land and crops requires supplies, such as fertilizer, that he must buy wholesale in order to properly care for his crops.  For this reason he is requesting a loan with which he will be able to make this purchase and thus move forward with his work, which supports his family.  Javier is grateful for the support that people around the world can provide so that his business won't stagnate, and to the Fundacion Alternativa for allowing him to apply for a loan from Kiva, which has motivated him to continue working with care and dedication so as not to disappoint those who have believed in him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Elsa is one of the members of the group called Cristo Redentor 1, 3 & 4. The group consists of 15 micro-business women from San Pedro de Macoris, from a batey (a company town) surrounded by sugarcane fields where they live and work for their families. They are selling clothes, miscellaneous products, shoes, groceries, food, etc. Elsa lives in a simple home with her family of five, including her children and her long-term partner.

Elsa started with Esperanza Internacional because she needed capital to start a business. She is very excited to be receiving her 13th loan from Esperanza after having successfully paid off her previous loans, and having taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for around seven years.

Elsa is planning to invest her new loan in purchasing rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, and others goods for daily meals. She is running a small food store, called a colmado, where neighbors can buy their goods in their own neighborhood. She said her most difficult challenge has been to start her business. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food,etc.

loans.name: Julián Andrés

texts.es: Julián, con 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Por falta de oportunidades laborales le ha sido difícil emplearse, luego de haber renunciado a la empresa de lácteos donde laboraba porque se presentaba mucha explotación del empleado. Por esta razón y con la necesidad de salir adelante y apoyar la economía de su familia, decide iniciar su propio negocio, una microempresa de comercialización y distribución de productos lácteos, aprovechando la experiencia de 4 años que adquirió en este campo; iniciará con la venta de quesos. Julián ya comenzó con el montaje de su negocio con unos ahorros que había guardado, pero requiere el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (máquina tajadora, máquina empacadora y selladora, refrigerador pequeño) e insumos (implementos de empaque, bolsas plásticas resellables), con esto logrará iniciar labores con su negocio y podrá generar ingresos para aportar al sostenimiento de la casa de sus padres, además podrá avanzar para cumplir el sueño de prosperar con su negocio, comprar queso en bruto al por mayor y tener su marca propia para distribución, de esta forma podrá tener mejor calidad de vida y brindarle un mejor bienestar a sus padres.
texts.en: Julián is 22 years old, is single, and has no children.  Due to a lack of job opportunities, it has been difficult for him to find employment after having quit his job at a milk and cheese factory because they were exploiting their employees.  For this reason, and with the need to move forward and support his family financially, he decided to open his own business, a micro-business for selling and distributing milk products, taking advantage of the four years of experience that he has in the field.  He will begin with selling cheeses.  Julián already began with a downpayment for his business via some savings that he had collected, but he needs the support of a loan in order to invest in the purchase of machines (a grating machine, a packing and sealing machine, and a small refrigerator), as well as materials (implements for packaging, plastic resealable bags). With this he will be able to begin the work of his business and will be able to generate income to support his parents, as well as advance and prosper his business, to purchase fresh cheese in bulk, and to have his own brand for distribution.  In this way he will be able to improve his quality of life and provide a better living for his parents.

loans.use: to purchase machines (a grating machine, a packing and sealing machine, and a small refrigerator), as well as materials (implements for packaging, plastic resealable bags, etc.).

loans.name: Hay's Group

texts.en:
Hay, 27, resides in a rural village of the Sampov Meas district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has two children, both still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been in growing rice and watermelon for several years. The current business earns her family about 15,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Hay has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three loans already. She successfully used the past loan to better support her family, providing  sufficient food and paying for her children’s education. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma is a 21-year-old woman. She is living in a poor area in Haja. She is a responsible woman who works hard to meet good financial standards. She applied for a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy new a fridge to use in her home. She was forced to apply for this loan because she doesn't have enough money. She hopes to buy furniture and home appliances to live comfortably

loans.use: to buy a new fridge to use in the house.

loans.name: Ebrahim

texts.en: Ebrahim is 22 years old and lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who likes to depend on himself. He works hard to provide his family's daily expenses. He has had a bus for few years. It is the only source of income for covering the daily expenses of his family. He has a small house and he would like to improve it. He requested a youth loan of 120,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials to repair his house. He hopes to improve his business and to buy another bus.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro, working alongside his family, specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver, given that the current price of silver is at its lowest point in years.

Pictured here with his sister, Ruth, Teodoro has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My artistic formation came from my dad during his work as an archeologist in pre-Hispanic sites, and later as the curator of a museum. That's when I became inspired to craft jewelry with designs and motifs unique to ancient Peru. One of my most cherished moments was when I had a small workshop and my children, Carlos and Alicia, were with me while I was cutting gems by hand. Then we put the gems through a little machine to perfect the contours. I love the idea that foreigners can share part of our history through my designs."

"I would like to send my gratitude and a big hug to all of you for this micro-credit loan. It is such a great feeling to know that there are people like you, who live faraway and know me only through a photograph, and yet you trust me with this credit."

Use the link below to view Teodoro's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8651

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for his handcrafted jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, a businesswoman from Liberia, is single and has three children between the ages of 6 and12. Her children are currently attending school and living at home. Victoria completed the 12th grade before starting her business. She lives and works in St. Paul, home to the oldest market in Liberia and known for its fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas where many residents live in substandard housing. 
Victoria has a table business and has been selling local soap for the past seven years. She works eight hours a day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is inadequate income. She intends to use the loan to buy local soap for her business. She started her business by selling to her friends. She likes her business because she makes a profit. She hopes to one day own a house.  
Victoria thanks you for supporting the borrowers at BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy local soap for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 35-yr-old Fatmata.  She is married and has 2 children, age 12 & 5 yrs. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling.  In 2011, Fatmata established her sugar, mayonnaise, sardines, powdered milk, etc. business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband in the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city, and her main customers are general community people. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more sugar, milk, sardines, etc. for resale. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a bigger shop, educate her children and build a dwelling house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, milk, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is thirty-two-year-old Daniel.  He is widowed and has two children aged four and seven. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help a sister with her daughter's education. 

In 2009, Daniel established his jeans, shirts, t-shirts, sneakers, belts and caps business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant after coming from the village. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are males. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,550,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Daniel requires a loan in order to pay for additional jeans and sneakers. He hopes that this loan can improve on the stock and raise the profits. In the future, Daniel plans to expand the business to a shop, and hopes to be able to raise enough profit to be able to take care of the needs of the family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for jeans and sneakers.

loans.name: Vickey

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Vickey from Liberia. She lives in St. Paul, a suburb located outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It has one of the oldest markets in the country and is known for fresh fish as it is located by the ocean. However, it is also one of the poorer areas and housing quality is often very low. 
Vickey is single with three children, including two who live at home and go to school. Her spouse works as teacher. Vickey has a business where she sells bread, sugar, oil, rice, etc from a table.  She has been in business for five years and works nine hours a day. She transports her goods by taxi. With this loan, she will buy bread, sugar, oil, rice, etc.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income. She started her business with money from her susu (saving club). She is proud of her business because she makes a profit. Her plan is to build a house.  She would like to thank the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, oil, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Hawa. She is married and has 2 children, ages 16 and 21 years. Hawa has 2 additional dependents who live with her for assistance in schooling. 

In 2002, Hawa established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more cartons of fish to sell and get more profit. She will use some of the money on transportation. 

Hawa planned to educate her children to university level and to construct a mini-cool room in her village. She was successful in educating her children and she is still planning to build a mini-cool room in the future through the profit that she makes. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish for resale.

loans.name: Amor Y Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maritza is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Esperanza (love and hope) 1 & 2. This group is located in a rural area of La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children. She says that her dream is to have her own house, and thanks to the loan and her savings, she has made it possible to plan it.

Maritza is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for almost six years, starting to sell products. Maritza plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different products like clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. She will also use future profits to reinvest in her business and provide for her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy clothes and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Vidalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vidalia tiene 43 años de edad, esta acompañada y es madre de 4 hijos. Es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su compañero de vida que se dedica a ordeñar las vacas y cuidarlas y  ella se  prepara para ir a  vender frutas y verduras en la ciudad  y en la tarde se dirige a la  parcela donde cultivan junto a su compañero de vida.   

Ella compra las cosechas de aguacate, mango, naranja, etc en los cantones aledaños a su residencia; ya que le sale mas barato.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos  vacas lecheras; ya que actualmente posee tres vacas; para producir queso y crema para la venta. Con la venta de lácteos mejorara su negocio lo que le generara mejores ingresos para el sustento de su familia. ella planea en un futuro poder construir su vivienda; ya que actualmente es de lamina.
texts.en:
Vidalia is 43 years old and is the mother of 4 children. She makes a living tending a parcel of land with her husband. Every morning, she and her husband wake up at 5:00 a.m. to milk their cows, and Vidalia gets ready to take fruits and vegetables into the city center for sale. In the afternoons, Vidalia and her husband return to their land to tend their crops.

In order to get the best prices, Vidalia purchases various fruits and vegetables from her neighbors for resale in the city center. The produce she purchases for resale includes avocados, mangos and oranges.

With the support from this loan, Vidalia plans to purchase two dairy cows. She and her husband currently have three dairy cows they milk in order to make cheese and cream for resale. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen her business and improve her family's quality of life as well as their house, which is in very poor condition.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 1000 chickens and the materials in order to build the coups (wood, nails, mesh netting) and to purchase concentrated feed for the animals.

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 42-year-old trader who lives in Teshie, Ghana. She has two children. She sells smoked fish, which is the only source of income for the family. Rebecca's husband helps her in the smoking and sales of the fish. She is interested in offering more variety of fish to her customers which will help her to increase her net income and savings as well. However, due to insufficient finances, she finds it difficult. 

Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner ID-Ghana so that she can buy and sell different fish to serve her customers better. With the profit, she wants to grow her business in the future. This is her second loan request from Kiva and she is very thankful to Kiva and ID-Ghana.

Rebecca is standing on the right in the photograph. Her fellow group member, Christiana, on the left, is a scarf and wax-print seller.

loans.use: to buy and sell different varieties of fish so that she can serve customers better.

loans.name: Maria Antonina

texts.es:
Doña María Antonina tiene 52 años de edad ella es ama de casa y agricultora, madre de 2 hijos y en compañía de sus esposo se dedican a la agricultura en la siembra de café. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que en su familia es una tradición y la practican de generación en generación siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y hoy en día en compañía de su esposo. La tierra que trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo y a la dedicación puesta por muchos años de trabajo.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para invertirlo en la limpia, mantenimiento, fertilización, abono para sus cultivos de café ya que es necesario dar esta clase de asistencia para hacer sus cultivos atractivos para sus clientes y demás compradores.

Sus planes son poder dar la asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos para poder sacar un producto de calidad y provechoso. Sus sueños como madre es poder darles a sus hijos una educación de calidad, contar con una familia estable y con las ganancias re invertir en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Maria Antonina, 52, is a housewife and a farmer and has 2 children. Together with her husband, they grow coffee. She has a lot of experience in this activity because it is a tradition in her family, practiced from generation to generation. Her parents taught her how to work the land and now she does it with her husband. They own the land they cultivate thanks to their effort and dedication over many years.
Maria Antonina is asking for financing through the field partner, COMIXMUL, to invest in cleaning, maintenance, fertilization and manure for her coffee crops. This type of assistance is necessary to make her crops attractive to her customers and other buyers.
Her plans are to give assistance and maintenance to her crops to obtain a quality and profitable product. Her dreams as a mother are to provide a good quality education for her children, to have a stable family and to reinvest her profits in the coffee crops.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mercedes Maricela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 63 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad que son casados. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Mercedes al ver que su marido no ganaba mucho en el campo en prendió un pequeño negocio  que le permite sacar adelante su hogar, ella tiene una tienda de víveres donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como aceite, arroz, detergentes, etc. también vende carne, pescado y quesos. Trabaja todos los días brindando la mejor atención a sus clientes ya que esta es la forma como ella gana más clientela.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir aun más su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.

Su sueño es aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Nueva Ilusión" (New Hope) meets every two weeks in Calí, which is located in the parish of Colon in the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is known for its hardworking people, the majority of whom make a living working in agriculture and raising cattle.

Mercedes, at 63 years of age, is a member of the group and has three grown, married children. Her husband makes a living as a farmer. When Mercedes realized that her husband's income was not going to cover their household expenses, she decided to open a small convenience store and generate additional, much needed income. At her store, Mercedes sells various food and household items, including: oil, rice, detergents, meat, fish, cheeses, etc. She works 7 days a week and always tries to give every single customer the best service possible.

With the support from this loan, Mercedes plans to purchase merchandise to stock her convenience store. She is a founding member of the Community Bank, and she is grateful for the support she has received from the institution. Her dream is to strengthen and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Modesta Andrea

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive la señora Modesta, tiene 58 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. 

Doña Modesta  para obtener sus propios recursos se  dedica al comercio, vende productos para el hogar como: (licuadoras, planchas, ventiladores, colchones, entre otros) a través de cartillas de la distribuidora La Gran Cadena, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, lleva en este negocio por más de 16 años con el cual ella ha podido salir adelante en sus gastos y también ayuda a sus padres.

Este crédito es para comprar licuadoras, planchas, colchones, entre otros artefactos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos. 

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The members of Crucita Communal Bank meet in the parish of Crucita in Portoviejo Canton.  The town is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it.  Tourists from around the country and the world visit there.  It's known as Crucita la Bella [Beautiful Crucita].

This is where Modesta lives.  She's 58 years old and single, and lives in her parents' house.

Modesta works as a merchant to earn her own resources.  She sells household products (blenders, irons, fans, mattresses, and other things) via savings books from the La Cadena distributorship.  She sells door-to-door.  She has been in the business for more than 16 years and has been able to get ahead in her expenses as well as help her parents.

This loan is to buy blenders, irons, mattresses, and other appliances.

She's a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it for the help the loans always provide.  Her dreams are to have good health and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy blenders, irons, mattresses, and other appliances

loans.name: Celia Maritza

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

En este lugar vive la señora Celia, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis  hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos  estudian en la universidad y viven con ella además de una nieta que es como su hija. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Celia tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también legumbres y ciertos artículos de bazar y papelería, ella también tiene unas cabinas telefónicas en el cual además de ofrecer el servicio de llamadas también realiza recargas telefónicas de varias operadoras. Trabaja todo el día desde las 6 am hasta las 18h00 y hasta más tarde a veces, ella tiene más de 14 años con sus negocios con los cual se gana algo que les ayuda mucho ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar víveres ya que con los créditos ella aumenta el negocio. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su meta es tener un local mucho más amplio.
texts.en:
In the town of Cadi in Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank "Nueva Illusion" meet every 15 days.  This is a place that is known for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and livestock production.

This is where Celia, 48, lives.  She is married, and she and her husband have 6 grown children.  Two of the children study at the university and live with her, along with a granddaughter who is like a daughter to her.  Celia's husband works as a farmer.

Celia has a small store where she sells all types of basic consumer goods such as: vegetables, housewares, and stationery.  She also has some telephone cabins, and sells cell phone recharges from various cellular providers.  She works every day from 6am until 6pm, and even later some days.  She's had this store for more than 14 years, and with her businesses she generates earnings that are a big help to her family, since her husband doesn't earn very much from his work in the fields.

Celia will use this loan to buy groceries, because she wants to expand her business.  She is a founding member of her communal bank, and she likes it because of the help that is provided with these loans.

Celia's goal is to have a much bigger store.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis a sus 44 años de edad es casado y no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como reciclador, además cría cerdos para la venta y los días domingo y lunes alterna con la venta de mercancía en un pueblo; estas actividades son la que le generan los ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. El titular es un hombre emprendedor, trabajador y dedicado a su familia y a su labor, siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por esta razón solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de reciclaje al por mayor (cartón, papel archivo, latas, cobre) para venderlo directamente a las chatarrerías mayoristas, sin intermediarios y así tener un margen de utilidad más alto, para poder continuar sustentando las necesidades de su familia. Luis tiene como meta principal velar porque sus actividades sean rentables y perdurables en el tiempo, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years, is married, and without children.  Currently, he works in recycling.  He also raises pigs to sell and on Sundays and Mondays sells merchandise in his village.  These jobs are how he makes the income he needs to take care of his family's daily needs.  He is an enterprising and hardworking man who is dedicated to his family and his work.  He is always on the lookout for ways to get ahead.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan so he can buy recycling wholesale (cardboard, newspaper, cans, and copper).  He resells them directly to wholesale junkyards without any middlemen.  In this way, he obtains more profits that he uses to keep meeting the needs of his family.  Luis' main goal is to keep going as is, because his work is going well and is dependable.  By so doing, he will improve the quality of life of his family and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: buy recycling wholesale (cardboard, newspaper, cans, and copper).

loans.name: Dilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Dilfredo, con 45 años de edad es padre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a ser arriero de mulas, llevando cargas por contrato de un lugar a otro, sale desde muy temprano a realizar su labor en compañía de un colaborador, dependiendo de la distancia que le deba recorrer, con el fin de aprovechar el tiempo para realizar varios viajes. Esta actividad la aprendió de su familia y actualmente cuenta con 5 mulas para realizar la labor. Es un hombre trabajador, juicioso y comprometido con las obligaciones del hogar, por eso lucha día a día para salir adelante al lado de su familia. Esa es su principal motivación para solicitar el apoyo del crédito, que desea invertir en la compra de 2 mulas para labor (2 animales), con esto podrá aumentar los contratos y generar más ingresos para su hogar. Dilfredo sueña con darle continuidad a su negocio, para que le permita tener una estabilidad económica y de esta manera brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dilfredo is 45 years old lives with his wife and two children. For the past 15 years he has worked as a mule driver transporting loads on contract from place to place. He leaves for work very early every morning and, depending on the trips in a given day, will work in collaboration with another driver. He learned this trade from his family, and he currently owns 5 mules that he rotates through various transport routes and tasks. Dilfredo is a very hardworking and level-headed man who is dedicated to his home and family.

With the support from this loan, Dilfredo plans to purchase 2 new mules for work in his transport business. He hopes this investment will help him to increase the scope and quantity of contracts he can handle and will lead to increased income for supporting his family. His dream is to strengthen and expand his business so he can provide his children with a bright future and quality education.

loans.use: to purchase two mules for transporting goods.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Doña Delfina con 33 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos, casada y agricultora que en compañía de su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de viveros de café y cultivos del mismo. Ella realizo sus estudios hasta el sexto grado y agradece el esfuerzo y apoyo económico. Sus hijos el mayor tiene 17 años quien también curso solo el sexto grado no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de apoyo económico y decidió irse para EE.UU para poder ayudar a sus hermanos y a sus padres, la segunda hija tiene 15 años y también tomo el mismo camino de su hermano mayor, la tercera tiene 13 años y con el apoyo de sus 2 hermanos mayores y  padres está cursando el primer año de ciclo común, la cuarta hija tiene 10 años y está  en cuarto grado y la quinta hija tiene 08 años y está cursando el segundo grado. Las tierras que trabajan en compaña de su esposo están ubicadas a 3 minutos de camino y eso le permite estar más atenta y cuidadosa de sus cultivos de café.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de Chapola (plantita de café) para la compra de abono, fertilizantes entre otros para poder cuidar y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos.  

Sus planes para el futuro es comprar más terrenos cultivados de café y así forjar un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos para obtener más ganancias y tener una mejor condición de vida. Sus sueños como madre es que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales cursando carreras universitarias para enfrentar con conocimiento los problemas económicos de manera favorable
texts.en:
Delfina, 33, is married and has 5 children. She is a farmer and together with her husband, they have a coffee plant nursery and also grow coffee. She studied until 6th grade (age 11) and is grateful for the financial support. Her eldest son is 17. He only studied until 6th grade as well, and couldn't keep studying due to lack of funding. He decided to move to the U.S.A. to be able to help his siblings and his parents. The second daughter is 15 and she followed the same route as her elder brother. The third daughter is 13 and thanks to the support from her older siblings and parents is studying in secondary school. The fourth daughter is 10 and is studying 4th grade and the youngest, 8 years old, is in second grade.
The lands that Delfina and her husband work are a 3-minute walk from home and this allows Delfina to pay attention and care for her coffee crops.
She is asking for a loan through the field partner, COMIXMUL, to purchase young coffee plants (known as "chapolas"), manure, fertilizers, etc. in order to care for and maintain her crops.
Her future plans are to buy more lands with coffee crops and generate an estate for her children, increase their income and have better life conditions. As a mother, her dream is that her children go to university and become trained professionals so that they will be able to face economic problems in a favorable way.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants and supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gladis Adriana

texts.es: Gladis, con 34 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Su vida productiva la ha empleado, trabajando en un negocio de comidas rápidas que tuvo durante muchos años, pero que tuvo que culminar, cuando se cambió de casa con su familia; dejando la carga económica a su esposo. Por falta de oportunidades laborales y, motivada por sacar adelante a su familia, ella decidió retomar el negocio de la venta de comidas rápidas y ubicarlo en la acera de su casa, para lo cual requiere el apoyo del crédito, con el que comprará un carro de perros por valor de $800.000 e insumos (panes, papas, carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas) por valor de $200.000 para un total de $1.000.000; esto le permitirá generar ingresos para apoyar la carga económica de su hogar, ya que solo depende de su esposo que es obrero de construcción y la economía familiar es muy inestable porque esa labor es muy incierta. Gladis sueña con darle continuidad a su negocio, que sea estable y perdurable en el tiempo, de esta forma podrá generar los recursos para apoyar el sustento familiar, brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de todos con una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Gladis, age 34, has two children.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her life partner.  She has used her life productively by working in a fast food business that she had for many years.  However, she had to stop when she moved houses with her family, which left the financial burden to her husband.  Due to the lack of work opportunities, and motivated to get her family ahead, she decided to take up her fast food business again.  She set it up on the sidewalk to her house.

That is why she needs the support of the loan to buy a hot dog cart for 800,000 COP and supplies (bread, potatoes, cold meats, salsas, and soft drinks) for 200,000 COP for a total of 1,000,000 COP.  This will allow her to generate income to contribute to her household’s financial responsibilities.  This is because she depends only on her husband, a construction worker.  The family’s finances are very unstable because this work is not very consistent.

Gladis dreams of giving continuity to her business, that it becomes stable, and that it lasts long-term.  This way she will be able to generate the resources to support the family, to give her children a better quality education, and to improve the quality of life for all of them with good financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a hot dog cart and supplies like bread, potatoes, cold meats, salsas, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Umbelina

texts.en:
