When he worked out of the house she was in charge of bringing the food to where he was working.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo  (Foundation Field), is to cancel an outstanding debt to the institution. The rest will be used to buy a new batch of chickens (100) so that their productive activity does not decrease. Additionally she will buy 5 pounds of concentrate. This way she can continue working with her chickens since this is an activity she likes.

At the same time it will help her to have more income and improve her economic situation so she can provide for her family in terms of food, health, clothing. Also it helps people who buy her wholesale chickens to no longer have to ask other suppliers and incur additional costs. 

Her goal is to expand the chicken business to have more and repair her galleys. In the rainy season the water is filtered which causes stress to the animal, which can cause a loss of business.

loans.use: to cancel an outstanding debt to the institution. The rest will be used to buy a new batch of chickens (100) so that their productive activity does not decrease. Additionally she will buy 5 pounds of concentrate

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 48 years old and married, with three children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell recycle materials business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional recycled materials to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell recycle materials for nine years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Alicia aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As the married parent of two children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the retailing of rice, and a buy and sell charcoal business. Cristina is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, canned goods, milk, coffee, eggs, spices, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store, her retailing of rice, and her buy and sell charcoal businesses.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, canned goods, milk, coffee, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Francisco Alberto

texts.es: Francisco, con 20 años de edad vive con su madre. Desde que tenía 16 alos de edad, conoció la actividad comercial, gracias a una tía que le enseñó las labores. Luego del abandono de su padre, su madre con pocos ahorros logró regalarle a su hijo una tienda de abarrotes, donde labora todos los días, para conseguir el sustento diario de su hogar y aportar a los gastos que se realizan constantemente. El titular es un hombre enérgico, su juventud le permite ser activo y muy dinámico, por esta razón solicita el crédito como apoyo para invertirlo en la compra de víveres y surtido (gaseosas, galletería, pasteles, productos lácteos), además desea realizar una mejora en el local que corresponde en poner una pequeña carpa fuera de su vivienda, así le dará mejor imagen a la tienda y podrá atraer más clientes, esto se traduce en mejores ingresos. Francisco sueña con realizar los estudios universitarios en el área comercial o administrativa, pues le gusta mucho ser comerciante, así logrará grandes cambios y mejoras en su vida y en la vida de su madre.
texts.en:
Francisco, 20, lives with his mother.  He has been familiar with commercial activity since he was 16, thanks to an aunt who taught him the jobs.  After being abandoned by his father, his mother, with limited resources, was able to give him a grocery store where he works every day to support the family and contribute to paying the constant expenses.  

Francisco's an energetic man.  His youth allows him to be active and very dynamic.  This is why he's requesting the loan to help invest in buying provisions and stock (soda, cookies, pastries, dairy products).  He also wants to make improvements in his space by putting up a small canopy outside his home.  This will make the store look better and he'll be able to attract more customers, which translates into better income.

Francisco dreams of studying business or administration in the university because he likes being a merchant.  This way he'll achieve big changes and improvements in his life and his mother's life.

loans.use: to buy provisions and stock

loans.name: Odalis Arely

texts.es:
La señora Odalis de 29  años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación, tiene 03  hijos   que dependen de ella, no tiene casa propia y vive en una comunidad San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Odalis se dedica desde hace 09  años al negocio de venta de golosinas como tacos, pastelitos, fresco natural, tamales, muéganos de yuca. Su venta es de forma ambulante en los barrios y colonias aledaños a su casa.
Doña Odalis es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante con sus hijos, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar materia prima como maíz, leña, carne de pollo, res, queso, repollo, cebollas, plátanos, etc. y a si seguir trabajando en su negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Doña Odalis con el apoyo del préstamo desea comprar más productos para vender más y así tener mejores ganancias, su sueño es un día tener su propia casa. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2013.
texts.en:
Odalis, 29 years old, lives with her husband in their home. She has 3 children who depend on her. She does not have her own home and lives in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

For 9 years, Odalis has worked as a food vendor of tacos, pastries, natural and fresh products, tamales, and yucca muéganos. She travels to make sales in the neighborhoods and outlaying villages near her house.

Odalis is a hard-working woman with a desire to move forward with her children. She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale materials such as corn, firewood, chicken meat, livestock, cheese, cabbage, onions, bananas, and other products. This will allow her to keep working in her business to move her children forward.

With the help of this loan, Odalis hopes to buy more products to sell and have better profits. Her dream is to have her own home someday.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2013.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, chicken meat, livestock, cheese, cabbage, onions, bananas, and other products for her business

loans.name: Nubia Inés

texts.es:
Nubia hace 6 años tomo la dedición de iniciar su salsamentaría al observar que a otros empresarios les era rentable, todos los días abre su negocio de 2 pm a 10 pm, trabaja con su empleado por horas, en un local exclusivo para la venta de sus productos, es un negocio rentable el cual le permite generar los ingresos necesarios para mantener su hogar y a su hijo menor.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar mercancía (licores, gaseosas, mecato, etc.), y para adecuar su local.
texts.en:
Nubia decided to start her delicatessen six years ago after observing that other businesses were profitable. She opens her business every day from 2 p.m. until 10 p.m.  She works with her employee for hours in an exclusive property in order to sell her products. It is a profitable business that allows her to make earnings necessary in order to support her home and her young son. 
She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase merchandise (liquors, soft drinks, cakes, etc.) and she can outfit her business.

loans.use: purchase merchandise and outfit her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pads of paper, notebooks and other related school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Francely

texts.es: Francely, a sus 27 años de edad es madre soltera de una hija de 3 años. Por falta de oportunidades de empleo, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio donde ofrece diversidad de artículos como artesanías, tarjetas, velas cerámicas, minutos a celular y alimentos como ensaladas de frutas, su negocio se encuentra muy bien ubicado ya que está a media cuadra del parque principal del pueblo donde reside, por lo cual ha tenido buenos resultados en ventas. Actualmente solicita el crédito para realizar mejoras en las herramientas de trabajo (arreglar nevera, poner tapas de vidrio al exhibidor) para evitar que le dañen las frutas. Con esto podrá darle continuidad a su negocio y tendrá la posibilidad de seguir creciendo para cumplir el sueño de darle un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Francely, 27, is the single mother of a daughter, 3.  She decided to start her own business because of a lack of job opportunities.  She sells a variety of items such as handicrafts, cards, ceramic candles, mobile phone minutes, and food like fruit salad.  Her business is very well located half a block from the municipal park in the town where she lives, so she has had good sales results.

Currently she's requesting the loan to make improvements on her work tools (fix the refrigerator and put glass covers on the display case) so the fruit won't spoil.

With this she'll be able to provide continuity for her business and keep growing to realize her dream of giving her little daughter greater well-being and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make improvements on her work tools

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is thirty years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, a part of Misamis Occidental province. She owns a farm where she plants and harvests corn to sell. She earns roughly 4,000 PHP a month.

Edwina joined GDMPC in 2012. She is applying for a 7,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use all additional profits from her farm to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Ermilinda

texts.en:
Ermilinda is married and lives with her family in Clarin, a part of Misamis Occidental province. Her husband earns an income by providing a motorcycle transport operation in their community while she sells food in her cafe.

Ermilinda and her husband need to fix up their motorcycle so as to offer better service. For this purpose she is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through Gata Daku MPC. She hopes to have a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to repair her husband's motorcycle

loans.name: Nerith

texts.es:
Nerith, de 54 años de edad, esta casada con Jeremías y tiene 4 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. El trabajo de Nerith consiste en la venta de flores por unidad o en arreglos florales de mayor vistosidad. Trabaja todos los fines de semana en el cementerio de su localidad. Instala su puesto colocando todas sus flores en baldes con agua y ofrece a la venta especies como claveles, girasoles, gladiolos, azucenas, lirios, violetas y las infaltables rosas en diversos colores. Trabaja sola ya que su actividad no requiere de realizar un gran esfuerzo físico. Lleva ya 7 años con este negocio y le esta yendo muy bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues disfruta de conversar con otras vendedoras al mismo tiempo que ofrece sus flores a las diversas personas que entran a visitar las tumbas y mausoleos de sus familiares, todavía no se siente realizada, ya que desea poner una tienda dedicada solo a la venta de flores, ya que siente que es momento de empezar a crecer y tener un local propio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará más flores variadas para surtir mejor su negocio y incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nerith, 54, is married to Jeremías and has 4 children. At the moment only one child lives with them in their own house. 

Nerith's work consists of selling flowers; single-stem flowers and floral arrangements. She works every weekend in the cemetery in her area. She sets up her stall hanging all her flowers in buckets with water and sells: carnations, sunflowers, gladiolus, lilies, irises, violets and roses in various colours. She works alone since her activity doesn't require great physical effort. She has been doing this work for 7 years already and it's going very well. She likes her job very much as she enjoys talking with other vendors while selling flowers to various people who come to visit their relatives' tombs and mausoleum. 

She still does not feel fulfilled since she wishes to have a store dedicated only to the sale of flowers, since she feels that it is the moment to begin growing and to have her own premises. 

At this time she is requesting 2000 Peruvian Soles. She is grateful and happy to know that she can continue to rely on the financial support that she needs to make progress with her business. 

With the amount requested, she will buy more assorted flowers to better provide her business and increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase flowers wholesale.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is fifty years old, married and has five children. For the past four years she has been raising livestock to earn money.

Bibiana has taken out six loans in the past from NWTF. She is now applying for a PHP 15,000 PHP loan to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Bibiana’s desire is to save money to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is married and the father of five adult children. He is 56 years old and lives in Guingona, Ozamis City, a part of Misamis Occidental province.

For years Henry has been in the motorcycle transport business, providing passenger service to the local community. Aside from this, he also has a garden where he grows and harvests vegetables to sell.

Henry is applying for a new loan of 11,500 PHP through GDMPC in order to buy fertilizer such as manure for his garden. He hopes to earn more money so he can buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Luis Faustino

texts.es:
Luis tiene 27 años de edad de estado civil unido  tiene un hijo vive con la compañera en el Recinto EL JOBO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla NUEVO JERUSALEN se encuentra ubicada el recinto EL JOBO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 


Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 


El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es comprar un terreno y seguir sembrando. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar.
texts.en: Luis is 27 years old and has a partner with whom he has a son. He lives with his partner in El Jobo village which is part of Ventanas canton in Los Rios province. He belongs to the Nuevo Jerusalen communal bank, located in El Jobo village in Ventanas canton, whose members work in agriculture and cattle rearing. Luis works in farming and grows corn, He is going to use the loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, manure and seeds. He will buy the products in the city of Ventanas. The loan will help him to increase his income and his crops. His dream is to buy a piece of land and carry on growing crops. He likes to play sports and work in his free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Héctor Darío

texts.es: El cliente reside en el área de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Se inició hace 6 meses con su negocio propio, aunque ya tenía experiencia en este campo desde muy pequeño, dado que siempre estuvo involucrado en esta actividad.  Generalmente trabaja solo, aunque algunas veces recibe las ayuda de sus hermanos.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Necesita del crédito para la compra de harina, aditivos y otros insumos para la fabricación de los productos de panadería que vende.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Fortín sector of Guayaquil. He started his own business six months ago. He has already gained experience since he has been in this line of work from a very young age.

The borrower generally works alone, although he sometimes receives help from his siblings. He is single and has no children. The borrower needs a loan so that he can buy flour, additives, and other supplies for making the baked goods that he sells.

loans.use: to buy buy flour, additives, and other supplies for his bakery.

loans.name: Hugo Fabricio

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 29 añod de edad es casado vive en San Jose de Chimbo con el esposo y con los hijos.

Hugo es chofer de un bus, el dienro lo solicita para la comprar de una lavadora y una television ya que no tiene la vadora y la television es de regalo de cumpleaños.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.

El sueño de hugo es tener un trabajo de oficina por que no le gusta ser chofer.
texts.en:
Hugo is 29 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in San Jose de Chimbo. He works as a bus driver.

The money he is requesting will be used to buy a washing machine and a television since he does not have these items. This will be a birthday gift to himself. In his free time, Hugo enjoys playing sports.

His dream is to have an office job since he does not like being a bus driver.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and a television.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 57 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Manuel y sus 5 hijos. Juana se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, leche, aceite, entre otros. Actualmente tiene una pequeña tienda en un espacio de su casa. Por fortuna, su puesto es muy surtido y la concurrencia de sus clientes produce la venta rápida de todo lo que ofrece. Trabaja a diario desde hace 4 años y lo hace sola pues su esposo se dedica a otras actividades. Le gusta de su trabajo por que puede conversar con sus clientes y atender a sus hijos, anteriormente vendía en una mesa, pero ahora su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco y espera seguir así. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para que pueda seguir adelante con su trabajo, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos comestibles como huevo, sal, aceite y plátanos ya que son productos muy solicitados en su tienda.
texts.en:
Juana, 57, lives in her own house with her husband, Manuel, and their five children. She makes a living selling groceries such as rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, and oil, among others. She currently has a small store located in her home. 

Luckily, her store is well-stocked and busy with clients, so that she sells everything she offers quickly. She has been working every day for four years. She works alone because her husband is busy with other activities. She likes her work because she can chat with her clients and take care of her children. Earlier, she sold products from a table, but now her business is growing little by little. She hopes this continues. 

She has applied for a loan of 500 Peruvian soles, and she is very happy to have this financial support to continue moving forward with her work. She is also committed to paying her installments on time. With the requested amount, she will buy more grocery items such as eggs, salt, oil, and bananas, because these products are in high demand at her store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as eggs, salt, oil, and bananas.

loans.name: Cesar Ceferino

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 29 años de edad es casado con la esposa y con  los hijos viven en la cuidad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La ventanilla el laurel se encuentras ubicada en el recinto el Laurel de la parroquia zapotal nuevo perteneciente al cantón ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas.

Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol además a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos, con crédito le ayudado a invertir en semillas, abonos, y fertilizantes para los cultivos y en balanceado para los animales.  

El crédito es de gran ayuda para aumentar la producción.

El sueño es tener salud y vida para seguir trabajando para dar todo a su hijo.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte con la familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 29 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the city of  Ventanas, Los Rios province. 

The El Laurel communal bank is located in the Recinto El Laurel in the Zapotal parish, belonging to the Ventanas canton. It is dedicated to agricultural work. 

Cesar works in agriculture. He plants corn, rice and beans. He also raises chickens and pigs. Loans have helped him in vest in seeds and fertilizer for his crops and in feed for the animals.  

The loan is a big help to increase production. His dream is to have health and life to keep working to give everything to his children. In his free time, he likes to play sports with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Liliana Andrea

texts.es:
Liliana desea iniciar una discoteca en el parque principal de puerto triunfo, lugar que ha funcionado por muchos años, pero por mal manejo fue cerrado, trabajara junto a otra persona quien tiene todo el conocimiento adecuado en manejo de bares y discotecas, el lugar abrirá los fines de semana, cumpliendo con el horario pactado en la norma (8:00 pm a 4:00 am).
Ella manejara el crédito para comprar surtido necesario (cervezas, licores, gaseosas, pasa bocas), y adecuar el local
texts.en: Liliana wishes to start a nightclub in the main park of Puerto Triunfo. This locale has been in operation many years, but it was closed due to poor management. She will work with one other person who has all the necessary knowledge in the management of bars and nightclubs. The venue will open on weekends and will fulfill the schedule normally kept by these establishments (8:00 pm to 4:00 am). She will use the loan to purchase the necessary assortment of goods (beers, liquors, sodas, snacks) and to adjust the venue.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of goods and to adjust the venue

loans.name: Lilian Maria

texts.es:
Doña Lilian con 33 años de edad es madre casada de 3 hijos los cuales el mayor tiene 11 años estudia en primaria cursando el sexto grado, el segundo tiene 4 años y está en el kínder y el tercero con nueve meses de nacido. En compañía de su esposo el cual es maestro de educación media se dedican a la caficultura y comercio ya que tienen también un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva y de segunda el cual está en su casa de habitación. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que desde muy temprana edad se dedica a la agricultura siendo sus padres agricultores desde toda una vida. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente para dar asistencia y mantenimiento.

Ella ha solicitado un apoyo financiero el cual lo utilizara para la comprar de chapola (plantitas de café), y la otra parte la destinara para la limpia y abono de sus cultivos que ya está sembrada y para la preparación de una parcela de tierra donde será cultivada la nueva chapola.

Sus planes para un futuro es poder aumentar el patrimonio para dejarles a sus hijos una herencia digna así como su padre lo hizo por ella y sus hermanos. Sus sueños es que sus hijos estudien y se gradúen de la universidad igual que su esposo y tengan una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lilian, 33, is married and has 3 children. The eldest is 11 and goes to primary school, 6th grade. The second child is 4 and is in pre-school. The youngest one is 9 months old. Her husband is a high school teacher. Together they have a coffee business and an additional business selling new and used clothing in their house.
Lilian has a lot of experience in agriculture because she started working as a farmer from an early age. Her parents were farmers all their life. Lilian's coffee crops are located 5 minutes from her home and they walk there daily to look after the crops and do maintenance.
She is asking for financial support to buy young coffee plants, called "chapola". She will also use part of the money to clean and buy manure for her already planted crops and to get an additional plot of land ready to grow the newly bought "chapola".
Her plan for the future is to increase her assets so that she can leave her children a decent inheritance, like her father did for her and her siblings. Her dream is for her children to study and go to university like her husband and for them to have a better quality of life and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and coffee plants for her crops

loans.name: Emma Beatriz

texts.es:
Emma tiene 32 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos vive en Chimbo con la esposa y con los hijos.

Emma trabaja como empleada privada el credito lo solicita para la comprar de una lavadora ya que es muy duro lavar la ropa a mano.

El Sueño de ella es tener siempre salud y trabajo para dar lo necesario a los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Emma, 32, is married and has three children. She lives in Chimbo with her spouse and kids. Emma works as a private employee.
She is asking for a loan to buy a washing machine because it is very hard to wash clothes by hand.
Her dream is to always be healthy and have a job to provide for her children.
In her spare time she likes to go for a walk with her family.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 39 years old and married with five children. Eseta not only has a plantation where she sells taro and bananas, but she also runs a small bakery selling donuts, pork cakes, and ice cakes in her community. She has been doing this for four years. 

For her business, Eseta has requested a loan to buy sacks of sugar, flour, cooking oil, yeast, cooking pots and pans, food storage containers, empty gallons, cocoa, wire, cement, and a truckload of granite sand. 

Eseta joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, she hopes to expand her business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy sacks of sugar, flour, cooking oil, yeast, cooking pots and pans, food storage containers, empty gallon jugs, cocoa, wire, cement, and a truckload of granite sand

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 22 años de edad, es madre de un hijo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora actualmente ayuda a su papá a cultivar granos básicos; ya que ella le lleva los alimentos a su papá hasta el terreno donde cultiva y se queda un par de horas ayudandole a realizar las labores que conllevan los cultivos de granos básicos. Esto lo hace a pasar que es madre soltera pero eso no le impide seguir adelante, al contrario eso la motiva mas para seguir luchando día con día.

Los insumos que utiliza para la siembra de granos básicos como herbicidas, fertilizantes, insecticidas los  compra en la ciudad. Desde su vivienda hasta la ciudad, viaja en camión y el recorrido tarda1 hora ya que la calle esta en mal estado y desde el lugar en donde la deja el camión,  le toca al papá cargar en la espalda los insumos.

El dinero sera invertido en la compra de 2 litros de herbicida, 2 sacos de fertilizantes y un insecticida para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de frijol. Esperando sacar su cosecha de buena calidad y mejorar su dieta alimenticia.
 

 Isabel quiere seguir ayudando a cultivar a su papá así como lo ha venido haciendo por mucho tiempo y ademas quiere en un futuro mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Isabel is 22 years old and has one child. She is a hard working woman that is now helping her father to grow basic grains. She brings her father his food to the land where they have the crops and then stays for a couple of hours helping him with the tasks involved in the growing of basic grains. She does this even though she is a single mother, because this doesn't stop her from moving forward. On the contrary, this is an additional motivation to keep striving every day.
Isabel buys the supplies she needs for sowing the basic grains, such as herbicides, fertilizer and insecticide, in the city. It takes her an hour to get from her home to the city in a truck due to the poor state of the roads. Then her dad has to carry the supplies on his back from the place where the truck drops them.
The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of 2 liters of herbicide, 2 sacks of fertilizer and insecticide to sow 14,000 square meters of beans. She hopes to get a good quality harvest and improve her food diet. Isabel wants to keep helping her dad the way she has been doing for a long time and, in the future, she wants to make home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase herbicide, fertilizer and insecticide to sow 14,000 square meters of beans.

loans.name: Anderson Gonzalo

texts.es:
Anderson tiene 23 años de edad de estado civil unido  tiene un hijo vive con la compañera en el Recinto EL JOBO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla NUEVO JERUSALEN se encuentra ubicada el recinto EL JOBO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 


Anderson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 


El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es comprar un terreno y seguir sembrando. Le gusta mucho trabajar.
texts.en:
Anderson, 23, is in a common-law marriage with one son. He lives in the community of El Jobo in the canton of Ventanas and the province of Los Ríos. He belongs to the Nuevo Jerusalen communal bank, which is also located in El Jobo in the canton of Ventanas. The members of the bank work in agriculture and livestock.

Anderson makes a living in agriculture by planting corn. With this loan, he will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and seeds. He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas. This loan will help him to increase his income and expand his crops. His dream is to buy a plot of land and continue planting. He greatly enjoys working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds.

loans.name: Ricardo Arturo

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 23 años de edad de estado civil unido  tiene un hijo vive con la compañera en el Recinto EL JOBO perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla NUEVO JERUSALEN se encuentra ubicada el recinto EL JOBO, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 


Ricardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 


El crédito le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y los cultivos. El sueño es comprar un equipo de sonido. Le gusta mucho trabajar y dormir. En frenta desafios como las plagas y enfermedades
texts.en:
Ricardo, 23, has a spouse and one son. He lives with his spouse in the community of El Jobo in the canton of Ventanas and the province of Los Ríos. He belongs to the Nuevo Jerusalen communal bank, which is also located in El Jobo in the canton of Ventanas. The bank's members work in agriculture and livestock.

Ricardo makes a living in agriculture by planting corn. With this loan, he will be able to buy supplies such as fertilizer, manure, and seeds. He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas. This loan will help him to increase his income and expand his crops. His dream is to buy sound equipment. He likes working and sleeping. He faces challenges such as infestation and crop disease.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds.

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Rey Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal el Señor es mi rey, está conformado por  trece integrantes once mujeres y dos hombres. Son originarias del sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Son personas que se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar  en familia de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. 

La coordinadora del banco comunal, es Vilma y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, queso, huevos, jugos, gaseosas, detergentes. Ella dedica a su negocio una 12 horas diaria, actividad que la disfruta mucho. El objetivo del crédito  es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Señor Es Mi Rey” (The Lord Is My King) consists of 13 members, 11 women and 2 men. They are originally from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country. These individuals are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. In their free time, they enjoy spending time with their children as a family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to attend school and were obligated to work at a young age.

The coordinator for this Communal Bank is Vilma. She manages a general store that is located in her home where she sells food products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, cheese, eggs, juices, and sodas, as well as detergents. Vilma works at her business approximately 12 hours each day and enjoys it very much. Her loan will be invested as operating capital so that she can restock her business of buying and selling food products. In the not-so-distant future, she hopes to generate more income.

The Communal Bank is grateful for the assistance that the Kiva lenders have provided to low-income people from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent form of work.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, cheese, eggs, juices, sodas, and detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn is from Pantaon, Ozamis City. She is 29 years old.  Cerelyn is married and has a child. 

To make a living, Cerelyn runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community. Cerelyn has been in her business for more than three years and earns 5,000 a month for these activities.

Cerelyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods, milk, sugar and spices. In 2011, Cerelyn joined GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, milk, sugar and spices

loans.name: Conrado

texts.en:
Conrado is 56 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, he owns and operates farmland, where he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has had his business for more than 10 years and earns 16,000 PHP every month. Conrado also manages a motor transportation service in the community to add to his income. 

Conrado joined GDMPC in 2010. Now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Maria Edendina

texts.es:
Maria Edendina tiene 47 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos, casada, agricultora y ama de casa que en compañía de su esposo se dedican a la siembra, corte, poda, limpia y fertilización de café. Ella también tiene un molino de maíz siendo este el único en la aldea por lo que tiene mucha clientela y le facilita un pequeño ingreso. De sus 5 hijos las 2 mayores ya están casadas en hogares a parte y viven fuera de la localidad, la tercera de 22 años ya se graduó de la secundaria como Bachiller en ciencias y letras por lo cual no pudo continuar en la universidad por la falta de recursos económicos, el cuarto de 18 años con un grado de ciclo común completo y la ultima de 14 años la cual esta cursando ciclo común. La tierra que cultivan es propia gracias a una herencia de sus padres siendo sus clientes las bodegas y exclusivamente una en particular la cual se dedica a la compra-venta de café en la localidad.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual planea comprar abono, fertilizantes entre otros para proteger y dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café.

Ella espera que con el apoyo financiero solicitado sus cultivos estén mas condicionados y protegidos los cuales puedan ser atractivos para su clientela. Como madre su sueño es que sus hijos continúen con los  estudios y puedan ser graduados en la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria Edendina, 47, is married with 5 children and is a farmer and housewife. Together with her husband they sow, cut, prune, clean and fertilize coffee crops. She also has a corn mill, the only one in the village, so she has many customers and this provides her with a small income.
Her two eldest daughters are already married and living in homes outside of town. Her third daughter, 22, graduated from high school in the specialty of sciences and arts but couldn't go to university due to lack of funding. The fourth son is 18 and has a completed "ciclo común", equivalent to high school until 16 years old. The youngest daughter is 14 and goes to high school.
The borrower and her husband own the land they cultivate, thanks to an inheritance from her parents. Their only customers are warehouses, and one in particular, dedicated to buying and selling coffee in the town.
Maria Edendina is asking for a loan through our field partner, COMIXMUL, to purchase manure, fertilizer, etc to protect and provide technical maintenance to her coffee crops.
With this investment, Maria Edendina hopes to have her crops better conditioned and protected, to make them more attractive for her customers. As a mother, her dream is that her children continue their studies and graduate from university.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 57 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married and has three adult children.

Elma has a public motorcycle transportation business, or trisikad, and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. She has a requested a loan to purchase one trisikad.

Elma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one motorcycle for her transportation business.

loans.name: Teodolinda Nicolasa

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  A su madre le gustaba el comercio, por lo cual ella aprendió desde pequeña a trabajar en él y también a desempeñarse de manera ordenada.  Labora sola en esta actividad, durante el transcurso del día.  Es casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y sus hijos estudian en la escuela fiscal.  Requiere el dinero del crédito para comprar pantalones, camisas y perfumes para comercializarlos.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Fortín sector of Guayaquil. She is a mother who enjoys working in the retail trade since she learned about this type of work at a young age. She goes about her business in an orderly manner.

The borrower works alone at her business throughout the course of the day. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a bricklayer and their children attend a state school. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy trousers, shirts, and perfumes that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Lucía Del Carmen

texts.es: La cliente es del sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Empezó desde temprano relacionándose con muchas personas, lo que le ha ayudado positivamente a desarrollar esta actividad (venta de productos Avon y artículos a crédito).  Se dedica a laborar sola durante el día a cualquier hora, no tiene horario fijo.  Es soltera pero tiene 3 hijos, todos ya adultos.  Desea invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, como cremas, champú y otros artículos de belleza.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the Fortín sector of Guayaquil. From an early age she has been socializing with many people, a skill that has helped her make positive development in her business. She sells Avon products and other items on credit.

The borrower works alone throughout the day at any given hour, since she has no fixed schedule. She is single and has three children, all of whom are adults. She wants to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of merchandise for her business such as crèmes, shampoos, and other beauty products.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, shampoos, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Romulo Napoleon

texts.es:
Romulo es soltero no tiene hijos vive en San Jose de Chimbo.

Romulo se dedica a la sastreria a la confeccion de ternos para hombres y mujeres.

El dinero lo solicita para la compra de material como:agujas, hilos, tijeras, cintas, metricas,tizas y tela para la confeccion de ternos. 

El sueño es tener mas clientela para a,pliar el negocios.
texts.en:
Romulo is single and has no children. He lives in San Jose de Chimbo.

Romulo is a tailor who makes suits for men and women. The money he is requesting will be used to buy materials such as needles, thread, scissors, tape measures, rulers, chalk, and fabric for making suits.

His dream is to have more customers so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, scissors, tape measures, rulers, chalk, and fabric for making suits.

loans.name: Avei

texts.en:
Avei is a 48-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams, bananas and other consumables to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. 

Avei has requested a loan to buy a mist blower, chemicals, rolls of fencing wire, nails, a knife sharpener, and an axe. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Avei plans to reinvest some of her profit to expand her plantation and to use some to assist with her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, chemicals, rolls of fencing wire, nails, a knife sharpener, and an axe

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario grows a rice crop on his one hectare of farm land. In addition to farming, he also raises hogs. He has been in the farming business for two years. He is thankful because through his hard work and patience, he was able to improve his rice farm lot in a span of two years.

Mario would like to have continuous good crop production so he can give education to his four children and to provide a comfortable living condition. To obtain his goal, he is requesting for a loan of PHP 15,000. This will allow him buy farm inputs like fertilizers and insecticide for maintaining his farm. He knows that this loan amount will have much to do with the improvement of his crop production.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and insecticide for maintaining his farm.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma, 55 years old, is from Gango Rizal, Ozamis City. She is married and has five children. For the past 14 years, Guillerma has run a general store where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Guillerma earns PHP 5,000 a month. In addition to that business, she also helps her husband in their farm, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. 

Guillerma is requesting a new loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and to cover the labor costs of replanting banana plants. Guillerma joined GDMPC in 2010. She dreams of business expansion in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to cover labor costs of replanting banana plants

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 34 años de edad, está casado  y tiene una pequeña hija con quien vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Wilfredo es la agricultura, para cumplir con su trabajo cuenta con 2 hectáreas sembradas con plátano de la variedad mas solicitada por la población. Cuando que tiene una buena producción por eso realiza la venta en cajones a otras ciudades pero en temporadas de baja producción realiza sus ventas en el mercado principal de la ciudad donde vive. Realiza su trabajo con el apoyo de su pareja quien lo ayuda en las labores de siembra y cosecha. Por fortuna su parcela se encuentra ubicada a escasa distancia del puerto fluvial lo cual le permite ahorrar en transporte. Le gusta su actividad pues lo considera rentable ya que le ha permitido tener un ingreso económico estable para mantener a su familia, comenta que escogió este oficio por la urgencia económica que atravesaba y  la necesidad de tener un trabajo, ahora con la agricultura se siente cómodo y contento. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará abono orgánico y semillas de plátano de otra variedad con el cual incrementará una hectárea más de terreno.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 34 years old, he's married and he lives in his own home with his young daughter. Wilfredo's occupation is agriculture, to fulfill his job he has 2 hectares sown with the preferred plantain variety of his population. When he's having a high yield he performs his sales in crates to other cities, but in low production seasons he makes his sales in the main market of the city where he lives. He completes his work with the assistance of his spouse who helps him with sowing and harvesting. Luckily, his plot of land is located a short distance away from the river port which helps him to save in transportation.

He likes his occupation, since he considers it profitable. It has allowed him to have a stable income with which to support his family. He adds that he chose this profession due to the pressing economical hardship he was going through and the need to have job. Now he feels comfortable and content with agriculture.

With this opportunity he requests S/. 1000, he is very happy with the financial support he receives to get ahead and he promises to pay his dues punctually. With the requested amount he will purchase organic fertilizer and plantain seeds of a different variety with which he will increase an additional hectare of land.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and plantain seeds

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 59 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo que ahora ya es independiente y tiene su propia familia. María se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado de manera ambulatoria por las calles de su ciudad. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es una vendedora muy alegre, que siempre saca a sus clientes una sonrisa. Dependiendo de la temporada, ofrece a la venta diferentes especies de pescado. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de extremo a extremo. Le gusta su trabajo por que puede conversar con sus clientes y bromear con ellos, además que le genera muy buenas ganancias ya que siempre tiene ventas considerables, al principio cuando se inició con este trabajo le era muy complicado ya que no sabia como conservar el pescado para que no se malogrará, pero con el tiempo logro aprender y ahora le esta yendo mucho mejor, espera tener en el futuro un pequeño frigorífico donde pueda vender sus pescados sin temor a que se malogren por el intenso calor. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está muy contenta de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará más pescado de diversas especies, ya que últimamente está teniendo mayor demanda.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old. She is the single mother of a son who is now independent and has his own family. Maria buys and sells fish in the streets of her city. She has a lot of clients, as her fish are the freshest and most delicious in the market. Plus she is a very cheerful vendor. She always manages to get a smile from her customers. Depending on the season she sells different types of fish. 

For 30 years now she has had this business covering the streets of the city from one end to the other. She likes her work. She can talk with her customers and joke with them. Plus she generates a good income as she always has good sales. When she first started this work it was much more complicated. She didn't know how to keep the fish so it wouldn't go bad. But she learned with experience and things are going much better for her. In the future she hopes to have a small icebox so she can sell her fish without having to worry about it going to waste in the intense heat.

At this time she is requesting 2500 PEN to buy more fish, of various species, as lately there has been a lot of demand.  She is very happy to receive financial support that allows her to get ahead. She promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy different species of fish.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Perseverance and determination have been Jonathan's guiding principles in his agriculture business. He is a grower of rice crops on his one hectare of rice farmland. He also grows selected vegetables on his 2,000 square meter farm plot.

Jonathan wants to improve his rice crop production, but due to insufficient capital, he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. This will allow him to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. He hopes to obtain his requested loan amount so he can further educate his two children and achieve financial stability. With financial stability, he could sustain his family's basic necessities and save an amount for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Evila

texts.es: Evila, de 32 años, está casada con Augusto y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Evila, se dedica a la venta de pescado. Su horario de trabajo empieza en la madrugada, se dirige al puerto pesquero de la ciudad y ahí obtiene las especies de pescado que tienen mayor precio en el mercado, sus ventas son al por mayor pero para que pueda vender todo tiene que esforzarse mucho para atraer a sus clientes porque asegura que la competencia es muy fuerte. Empieza a trabajar a las 4 de la madrugada y termina a las 7 u 8 de la mañana. En ocasiones vende en el frontis de su vivienda. Lleva en esta actividad más de 5 años, trabaja sola y afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso. Le gusta la libertad que le brinda este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y practicando algún deporte además de estar al lado de su familia, espera seguir trabajando para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero que le permita seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor variedad de pescado y plátanos para complementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Evila, 32, is married to Augusto and has 5 children who live in their home. Evila sells fish, starting very early in the morning when she goes to the fishing docks in the city to get the types of fish that have the best market price. She makes her sales in bulk, but in order to sell everything she has to work very hard to attract her customers, as the competition is strong. She starts work at 4am and finishes at 7 or 8am. Sometimes she sells from in front of her home. She has been doing this for more than 5 years, working alone, and she says that the gains that she has made as a result of her good work and the  money that she has generated for her family are her primary motive for looking for ways to improve. She likes the freedom that this business gives her, since she can enjoy her afternoons playing and participating in sports alongside her family. She hopes to continue working so that she can keep growing her business. 

On this occasion she asks for 1500 soles. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support that will let her continue forward, and promises to make her payments on time. With the requested amount she will buy a greater variety of fish and plantains to complement her sales.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of notebooks, paper, ballpoint pens and food and drinks.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetable, spices, meat, fish, etc for her restaurant business.

Edna has been in this business for one year. Edna earns more income from rice farming.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetable, spices, meat, fish, etc for her restaurant business

loans.name: Suny

texts.es: Suny de 21 años de edad , esta casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años con quien vive en su casa propia. Suny se dedica a la venta de combustibles al por mayor y menor. Tiene su negocio instalado en una esquina muy concurrida por vehículos de transporte pesado y vehículos menores como motos y mototaxis. Su trabajo le brinda buenos ingresos económicos y se siente muy tranquila ejerciendo esta función, el cual lo realiza con ayuda de su esposo desde hace 2 años y gracias a la buena calidad del combustible que vende y a su agradable atención ha sabido consolidar una buena clientela. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, le agrada ver que sus clientes se van muy complacidos y que los choferes transitan seguros en sus vehículos. Trabaja por las mañanas mientras que en las tardes regresa a su hogar a cumplir con las funciones de madre mientras su esposo continúa brindando el servicio en su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará combustible al por mayor para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en: Suny is 21, married, has a 7-year-old son with whom she lives in a house they own.  Suny sells fuel as wholesale and retail.  Her business is located in a busy corner with heavy load vehicles and smaller vehicles such as motorbikes and motor taxis. Her business provides good income and she feels good doing this activity, she is helped by her husband, they have done this for two years and thanks to the good quality of the fuel and the good service they provide she has been able to build a good clientele.  She really likes her work, she enjoys seeing happy customers and seeing them driving safe in their vehicles.  She works in the mornings and in the afternoons goes home to do her mother duties while her husband continues providing service at the business.  At this time, she requests 1,500 PEN and is very happy to know she will have financial support, this will give her the confidence to move forward with her business.  On the other hand, she commits once again to make the repayments punctually.  With the amount requested, she will buy fuel at wholesale to continue selling.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fuel to sell.

loans.name: Margaret Albany

texts.es:
Margaret una emprendedora que desde hace 3 años tiene su propio spa, en el cual hace masajes corporales a domicilio o en una habitación de su casa, muy conocida en su barrio por la calidad de los masajes y sobre todo la calidez humana y el compromiso con sus clientes.
Ella destinara el crédito para comprar equipos de trabajo (Madero terapia, lociones, esencias, camilla, manta térmica, etc.), que mejorara la calidad y la variedad del servicio que ella ofrece, permitiéndole aumentar el nivel de ventas.
Anhela ver su Spa crecer, fortalecerlo y diversificar su servicio, para lograr su objetivo principal que es tener su casa propia
texts.en:
Margaret is an enterprising woman. She has owned her own spa for the past 3 years, where she gives body massages as a home service or in a room in her house. She is well known in her neighborhood for the quality of her massages, but above all for her kindness and warmth and her commitment to her clients.

She intends to use the loan to purchase equipment for her work (wood therapy tools, lotions, essential oils, massage bed, thermal blanket, etc) which will improve the quality and variety of the service she offers. This will allow her to increase her sales. She yearns to see her spa grow, to strengthen it and diversify its service so that she may attain her main goal of having a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase massage therapy equipment such as wood therapy tools, lotions, essential oils, massage bed, thermal blanket, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sow and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her dairy and livestock business

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 42 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella trabaja en una entidad del estado pero en sus horas libres se dedica atender su bar y le va muy bien, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar bebidas como cerveza y gaseosas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Margot was born in the city of Paucartambo and still lives in that city. She is 42 years old and lives with her domestic partner with whom she has four children. She is a working mother and entrepreneur who is getting her family ahead through her work. She works for a government entity but in her free time she tends to her bar and it is going very well. She has been a member of the communal bank "Virgen del Rosario" for a number of years. 

At this time she requires a loan to purchase drinks such as beer and sodas. She appreciates and values the this loan and promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase drinks such as beer and sodas.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 51 years old. She supports her family with her buy and sell business. She has kept the business going for 13 years now and has gained a motorcycle that she uses for her business. Now, she is requesting a loan for motorcycle repair. She hopes that everything will go smoothly with her business so she can continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 50 years old and a married woman. She works hard to support her family of seven members. She has a business selling vegetables in a market, normally making a net profit of $10.00 per day. She has many new customers who come to buy vegetables from her store. She has operated this type of business for more than three years.

She requested a USD 1,000 loan through HKL to buy more vegetables and meat to sell. This way, she can satisfy and increase the number of customers and generate a good profit in order to meet their living needs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and meat to sell.

loans.name: Evaristo Reinaldo

texts.es: El cliente vive en el sector de Fortín en Guayaquil.  Empezó a involucrarse en este negocio cuando tenía 15 años y su padre lo llevó a un taller para que pudiera apreciar la manera en la que se trabajaba.  Desde ahí le agradó el oficio de mecánica automotriz.  Su trabajo lo realiza solo, de lunes a sábado en el horario de 8 am a 5 pm.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos.  Desea invertir el dinero en la compra de soldadura, una mesa de trabajo y demás insumos necesarios para su taller.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the Fortín sector of Guayaquil. He became involved in this line of work when he was 15. His father took him to an auto repair shop so that he could appreciate the way things were done. Since that time, he has enjoyed being an auto mechanic. He works alone, Monday through Saturday, from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. The borrower is single and has no children.

He wants to invest the money in the purchase of soldering equipment, a work table, and other needed supplies for his repair shop.

loans.use: to buy soldering equipment, a work table, and other needed supplies for his repair shop.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 48 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Jesusa is engaged in a snack vending activity and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials for her house repairs and renovations. 

Jesusa has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Jesusa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her house repair and renovation

loans.name: Agar

texts.en:
Agar is 55 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents. 

Agar has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell.

Agar has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is 33 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with two children.
 
Rey is engaged in a hog-fattening activity and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing piglets and sacks of feed for his hog fattening activity.  

Rey has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rey hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 56 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Candelaria has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell.
 
Candelaria has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 63 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children.
 
Editha is engaged in a fish-selling business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to pay the processing fees for her son’s employment abroad and to purchase additional banyeras (tubs) of fish for resale. 

Editha has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Editha hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay processing fees for her son’s employment abroad and to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 68 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with two children. 

Antonieta is engaged in a fishing activity and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing fishing tools and fishing nets for her livelihood. 

Antonieta has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Antonieta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools and fishing nets

loans.name: Fita

texts.en:
Fita is 36 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Fita is engaged in hog raising and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase sacks of feed for her existing hog raising business.

Fita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is 51 years old and married with 10 children.

Heide works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of recycled materials.

Heide has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of recycled materials business for 15 years and earns additional income from food vending and buying and selling motorcycle parts.

Heide aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of recycled materials

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en:
To increase the population of pigs, the Mawar group decided to have another loan from MUK. These loans are used to buy superior or local piglets, feed and also to renovate the cages.

Ni Komang used her loan to purchase superior piglets for fattening. The pigs will be kept for six months until they reach the maximum weight. Now the price for 1 kg of pig is between 15,000 IDR and 18,000 IDR depending on the quality of the meat. Ni Komang hopes in this period she will earn enough profit. This time she will save all the profit.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets for fattening

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña gloria, es una madre que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos, hoy en día solamente tiene a una hija a su cargo quien va a la escuela secundaria, ya muy pronto tiene que ir ahorrando porque entrara a la universidad. recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien también a su lado trabaja arduamente como radio técnico. Gloria para mantener equilibrado sus gastos infaltables de la casa, solicita el crédito para poder invertir en el negocio con variedades de ropa, calzado, bolsos y también pollo y verduras lo cual vende para obtener ingresos por este medio, para la manutención de la familia siendo este el único medio seguro de ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria is a mother who is concerned about the welfare of her children. Today she only has her daughter who is in high school and still under her care. Very soon her daughter will be leaving because she will be entering the university. Gloria has the support of her husband, who works hard at his job as a radio technician.

In order to keep her household expenses in check, Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business. She will buy a variety of clothes, shoes, and purses, as well as chickens and vegetables that she can sell to generate income. This will enable her to sustain her family since the business is her only sure means of earning household income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes, shoes, and purses, as well as chickens and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 35 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos a quienes educa con mucho amor. Reyna se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas de la zona y asados de pollo, cerdo y pescado, para ello instala su mesa en el frontis de su casa desde donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Realiza este negocio desde hace 3 años y cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor para la preparación de los potajes y la atención de los clientes. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y la necesidades de sus pequeños hijos quien es la motivación para seguir progresando, por lo contrario no le gusta cuando los precios de su insumos suben reduciendo sus ganancias pero aun así logra encontrar la rentabilidad en sus ventas, tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y mantenerlo como lo ha hecho hasta ahora. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas. Se compromete a ser una cliente puntual y muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas a precio por mayor para así tener mejores ganancias, tales como arroz, aceites, papas, y demás.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 35, lives in her own home with her husband and their four children who she trains with great love. She sells traditional local dishes as well as roasted chicken, pork, and fish. Reyna has a table set up in front of her house where she provides friendly and cordial service to her customers. She has been in this business for three years and has the help of her oldest daughter who prepares the stews and waits on the customers.

Reyna enjoys her business because it allows her to have income to pay for household expenses and provide for the needs of her young children. They provide her with the motivation she needs to continue making progress. On the other hand, Reyna does not like seeing the prices of her supplies go up because that means she earns less profit from her sales. Her goals are to continue her business and maintain it at the level it is operating now.

Reyna is taking this opportunity to request 1,000 PEN. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received to access the loan she needs to continue pursuing her goals. Reyna promises to be punctual and responsible with her loan payments. The amount she requested will be used to purchase ingredients in bulk for preparing her dishes such as rice, oil, potatoes, and other items.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, potatoes, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install water pipes in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase molds, a mixer, and ingredients for the preparation of pastries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more health products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Sophie Lum

texts.en:
She is a widow with 5 children and they all live in a three-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced same challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to start up a business, the death of her father, and the repatriation of her son from abroad.
With this loan, she plans to invest by buying firewood and part of the loan will be invested in farming by buying yam seedlings. She will also use the rest to pay workers who will clear her farm and split her firewood. She believes the business will succeed because she has been doing it for a long time, has regular customers, and has fertile land to cultivate her yam seedlings. The community will benefit because there will be no scarcity of firewood around and the community will have enough food.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs, ensure her children's education, and she will build her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy firewood and yam seedlings

loans.name: Maa Jogamaya Group

texts.en:
Lakshi is 31 years old. She lives with her two sons of 13 and 7 years, one daughter of 11 years and her husband in their own home at Bolangir of Odisha, India. The lady standing with the raised hand and the smiling face is Lakshi. 

Lakshi is an admirable woman; she had to educate and raise her children on her own. To do so, she has been running a business selling broiler chickens for the last seven years in her home town. She works eight hours a day and is well known by her customers, who know that she sells quality broilers. She earns a net profit of 300 INR per day. 

To increase her business, Lakshi, along with four other women members of her locality, formed a Joint Liability Group for availing a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. This is her second loan from the organization, and she wants use the loan to purchase more numbers of broilers and make a shed for safety. She hopes to develop a poultry farm in the future and give a better education to her children.

The other four members of her group are Sanjukta, Dasmati, Balmati and Subarnna, running businesses of fast food & tiffin center, tailoring center & vegetable vending, tea stall, and vegetable vending respectively.

loans.use: to purchase more broilers and make a shed.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Fanny ella es soltera y tiene 18 años de edad; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cosméticos como perfumes, colonias, cremas entre otros, la socia vende de forma independiente a todas sus amistades, familiares entre otros, a la vez la socia es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad en uno de los institutos de la ciudad, siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas para su negocio.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de ropa, restaurante, reciclador, venta de comida, venta de carne y pejerrey.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These partners are members of the community bank "Señor de Los Milagros" ["God of Miracles"]. This communal bank is located in the Cusco district  in the Cusco province of the department of Cusco.

One partner is Fanny who is single and 18 years old. She alternates her daily activities between her business, where she independently sells cosmetics such as perfumes, colognes and creams, among other things, to all her family and friends; and simultaneously she is studying the field of accounting at one of the schools in the city, which will be her form of getting ahead.

Fanny requests a loan to purchase women's perfumes for her business. Fanny thanks those who support this dream through this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

The other partners make their living through clothing sales, restaurants, recycling, selling food, and selling meat and "pejerrey" [a type of fish].

loans.use: to purchase women's perfume for her business.

loans.name: Noy

texts.en:
Noy is 64 years old. She is widowed and resides with her four children in the Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $1 daily. Three of her children are employed and earn an income of $7 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Noy is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike to run a taxi service. This purchase will help generate more income for the family. 

In the future, Noy would like to fix her house to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise for his used clothing business.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is 36 years old. She is married and resides with three children in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She has been selling fruits for more than five years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a driver who earns an income of $4 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in transporting her fruits, Phea is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to use in her fruit-selling business. This purchase will help her to transport her fruits faster. 

In the future, Phea would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use for her fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build an enclosing wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new products (flavor extracts, concentrate and vitamins).

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi est une femme de 36 ans. Elle est mariée à un transporteur et est mère de famille. Kayi est revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle propose à ses clients des tissus et des pagnes. Elle manque d’argent ce qui l’empêche d’avoir un stock consistant. De fait, Kayi sollicite un troisième prêt chez WAGES. Elle utilisera son crédit afin de s’approvisionner en marchandises. A terme, elle voudrait ouvrir une boutique de vente de pagnes et de tissus. Elle espère aussi pouvoir acheter un terrain et contribuer au besoin du ménage.
texts.en: Kayi is a 36-year-old woman. She is married to a transportation worker and is a mother. She has been a reseller since 2002. She offers her customers fabrics and pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth). She does not have enough money which prevents her from having a consistent inventory. This is why she is requesting her 3rd loan from WAGES. She will use her loan to get more merchandise. In the long run, she would like to open a shop selling pagnes and fabrics. She also hopes to be able to buy some land and contribute to the household needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric and pagnes (traditional cloth).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 3 dozen pieces of children's clothing and 2 dozen scarves.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary is 30 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for more than two years, earning approximately $7 daily. Her husband is an arc welder who earns an income of $10 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sary is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. This money will help her add more stock to her store and generate more income for the family. 

In the future, Sary would like to expand her store and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she wants to rebuild her house to make it much stronger and provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To put down a cement floor.

loans.name: Kokouvi
