texts.fr: Mr Kokouvi est marié à une coiffeuse. Il a 46ans et a 04 enfants. Ils sont tous sur les bancs de l’école. Il a pour profession infirmier. C’est depuis 1999, qu’il exerce ce métier. Il a été engagé dans une école pour soigner les élèves en cas de besoin mais la possibilité aussi lui a été donnée de prendre soin des patients de l’extérieur. Des employés l’aident et il sollicite de WAGES un troisième  crédit pour s’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques. Il veut épargner pour ouvrir un cabinet médical  et permettre à ses enfants de mieux se scolariser.
texts.en: Kokouvi is married to a hairdresser. He is 46 years old and has 4 children who are all going to school. He has been working as a nurse since 1999. He was hired by a school to take care of the students when necessary, and he has also been given the possibility to care for patients outside of school. He is helped by some employees and is requesting a 3rd loan from WAGES in order to buy pharmaceutical products. He wants to save up so that he can open a clinic and make sure that his children get a better education.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas is 28 years old. He is married and resides with three children in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. He is an automobile mechanic. He makes an income of $20 daily. His wife is a housekeeper, who looks after her children at home. 

In order to improve his family’s finances, Meas is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cassava seeds to cultivate. This money will help him acquire the ability to run a new business and generate more income for the family. 

In the future, Meas would like to build a new house and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cassava seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en:
Yoeum is 48 years old. She is married and resides with one chid in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She has been employed as a farm worker who earns an income of $3 daily. Her husband (who joins her in the picture) is a Khmer traditional musician. He earns about $7 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Yoeum is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase traditional music instruments for her husband to play. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase traditional music instruments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install flooring and interior fittings.

loans.name: Akua

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbons de bois à domicile, madame Akua est mariée à un professeur d’école Âgée de 46ans, elle est mère de 03 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé est âgé de 14ans et le dernier 07ans. Afin d’acheter des charbons de bois, elle fait un second crédit à WAGES. Les profits tirés de cette vente l’aidera à acheter en quantité considérable les charbons de bois et satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en: A reseller of charcoal from her home, Akua is married to a school teacher. She is 46 years old and the mother of 3 children who all attend school. The eldest child is 14 years old and the youngest, 7. She is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal. The profits she makes thanks to these sales will enable her to buy a considerable quantity of charcoal and to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr: Née en 1967, mariée à un tailleur, madame Ramatou pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille revend depuis 1999 des chaussures et trousseau bébé au marché. Son souhait est d’agrandir son activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille avec le profit tiré de son premier crédit.
texts.en: Born in 1967 and married to a tailor, Ramatou has been selling shoes and baby outfits at the market since 1999 so that she is able to contribute to her family's needs. Her wish is to increase her business and to use the profit she makes thanks to this loan to ensure that her family blossoms.

loans.use: to buy shoes and baby outfits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock tennis shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a gate in front of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El Sr. Vicente tiene viviendo en la cd. de Piedras Negras desde hace 45 años, es un hombre casado, muy responsable en cuanto a  darle todo lo mejor a su familia y no les haga falta nada, es padre de 3 hijos, de los cuales  un hijo estudia fuera de la cd. el cual ya pronto se recibe, lo apoya su esposa economicamente, pues ella labora en una editorial muy reconocida de esta cd. con el puesto de gerente de recursos humanos, lugar donde tiene una antigüedad aproximada a 5 años.
El Sr. Vicente cuenta con un negocio de venta de muebles de madera y objetos para el hogar como estufas, salas, lavadoras, nuevos y usados, negocio con el que cuenta desde hace aproximadamente 5 años.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA para poder aperturar otro negocio en una avenida muy transitada, lugar en el que le ayudará un hermano hacerse cargo de él, pero el dueño será él mismo de los dos lugares, solo que en el negocio actual será el Sr. Vicente quien siga atendiendolo, quisiera tambien en un futuro poder tener su propia mueblería de puros artículos nuevos y seguir ofreciendo calidad a sus clientes distinguidos.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente has been living in the city of Piedras Negras for 45 years. He is a married man and very responsible with everything he lives his family so that they lack for nothing. He is the father of 3 children. One son goes to school out of town and will graduate soon. He wife helps him financially, because she works at a very well known publishing house in this city as a human resources manager, a place she has worked at for 5 years. 

Vicente has a business selling wooden furniture and household items such as stoves, living room sets, and washers, both used and new. He has had this business for approximately 5 years. 

He is asking for help through Kiva in order to open another business on a very busy street. His brother will help him run it, but he will be the owner of both places. Vicente will be the one running the present business. In the future, he would also like to have his own furniture store selling all new items and keep offering quality to his distinguished customers.

loans.use: to open another business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wall for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante, ella tiene 54 años edad y tiene un hijo, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde prepara ricos plato de comida y le va muy bien entonces en esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo pollos, carne, papas, verduras y otras cosas más, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.  

Eulogia nació y vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo donde no hay industrias, empresas, bancos pero sus vecinos se las ingenian para hacer un tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother. She is 54 years old and has one child. She has a small restaurant where she prepares delicious food and it's going very well for her. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more supplies such as chicken, meat, potatoes, vegetables, and other things. She is a member of the communal bank "Virgen del Rosario", and is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to the responsibility of making her monthly payments on time.

Eulogia was born and lives in the city of Paucartambo where there are no industries, businesses, or banks, but her neighbors encouraged her to create a business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as chicken, meat, potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Luisa Gualupe

texts.es: Luisa es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene 54 años edad y tiene siete hijos, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de mates y jugos de forma ambulatoria desde las 4:30 am hasta 10 a.m. de lunes a viernes y le va muy bien entonces en esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, harina y otras cosas más, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking and enterprising woman that is getting ahead with her family. She is 54 years old and has seven children. She has a small business; she sells infusions and juices as a street vendor, from 04:30 am until 10:00 am, from Monday to Friday. She does well, so this time she is requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as sugar and flour.

Luisa is a member of the communal bank “Virgen del Rosario”. She appreciates the loan and promises to pay the installments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene 52 años edad y tiene tres hijos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende diferentes productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercaderia como por ejemplo sacos de  azúcar, sacos de harina, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Luisa is hard working and an enterprising individual who strives to see her family be successful. She is 52 years old, has three children and she has a small store where she sells groceries that she runs out of her home, where she sells different products like rice, sugar, beans, detergent and other items. She wants to take advantage of this opportunity to ask for a loan so she can purchase more merchandise like sugar, flour, rice and more. She belongs to a communal bank called "Virgen del Rosario," and she is grateful for the loan and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: purchase more stock like sugar, flour, rice and more.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom is 53 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling meatballs for more than ten years, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband is a musician who makes an income of $12 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $4 per day. Due to lack of funds, Sokhom is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase timber and zinc to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to fix her house.

loans.name: Mex

texts.en:
Mex is 59 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating cassava for more than ten years, earning approximately $15 daily. In addition, she is a tailor. Her children are employed. They earn about $28 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Mex is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase cloth to make more clothes to sell. Additionally, a part of this money will be used to buy pesticide to use in her cassava cultivation. This money will help her expand her shop and earn more income for the family. In the future, Mex would like to expand her farming business to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to make more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Phorlly

texts.en:
Phorlly is 45 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a security guard in a private company for more than two years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction worker. In addition, he runs a motor taxi service when he is free from his work. He makes an income of about $5 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $8 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Phorlly is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a Tuk Tuk (three-wheeled auto rickshaw) for her son to run public transportation. This purchase will help him generate additional income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to take another loan from KREDIT to restart her previous business of selling vegetables, and also to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk-Tuk for her son to run public transportation.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 47 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a traditional musician who makes an income of $3 per day. In addition, they are rice farmers. One of her children is also employed in the factory and earns about $4 each day. 

In order to improve her farming process, Sina is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase cattle to use for plowing her farmland. This money will help her grow rice faster. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for plowing her farmland.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay is 31 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been making trunks (made of palm leaf midribs) to sell for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $8 per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Lay is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of raising pigs and also to send her children to a good school

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is 38 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in raising pigs for more than two years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband runs a business of buying and selling motorbikes. In addition, he runs a rice-grinding service. He makes an income of $6 per day. 

Due to difficulty in her family’s transportation, Samnang is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en: Rithy is 31 years old. He is a widower, blessed with two children, and living in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in making metal doors and windows for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. In order to improve his business, Rithy is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase metal to use in his business. This money will help him expand his business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to rebuild his house and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase metal to use in his business.

loans.name: Sangvath

texts.en:
Sangvath is 23 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a police officer. He makes an income of $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sangvath is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase farmland to use for farming. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 55 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer noodle for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They make an income of $8 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Yen is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell. By doing so, she would be able to make more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is 38 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $4 daily. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Thon is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her save some money on her transportation to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Henry Jair

texts.es:
Henry es un joven de 24 años de edad, esta soltero. Aprendio el oficio de pescar desde que era un niño, ya que nació a las orillas de la zona costera de El Salvador, fue con su papa que aprendió; ya que ellos siempre se han mantenido de esta actividad, debido a que en El salvador las oportunidades de empleo son muy mínimas.

Henry hace dos jornadas de pesca en la semana, cada jornada dura un día y una noche adentro del mar, colocando trasmayos y recogiendo los pescados atrapados, durante la noche duermen sentados en la lancha y haciendo turnos con otro compañero, todo  el producto que consiguen lo venden en su misma comunidad,  en los días que no pescan hace viajes con su pick up a personas que necesitan ir a la ciudad a realizar algunas compras. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar repuestos para su vehículo, también para hacerle un encajuelado al chasis debido a que se le esta deteriorando, comprara un escape nuevo y otras reparaciones.  De esta manera,  reparara bien su vehículo y estará siempre listo para cuando sus vecinos necesiten de sus servicios y no perderá de ganarse algún dinero para su familia.

Planea ahorrar y comprarse un buen carro de un modelo reciente y comprar una lancha.
texts.en:
Henry is 24 years old and is single. He learned to fish when he was a child as he was born in a coastal zone in El Salvador. He learned from his father. They have always worked in this activity since employment opportunities in El Salvador are very minimal.

Henry fishes twice a week. Each day lasts a day and one night on the sea, setting nets and capturing the fish. During the night, they sleep seated in the boat and he takes turns with other coworkers. All the products that they get they sell in their own community. On days that he doesn't fish, he uses his pick-up truck to transport people who need to go to the city to do some shopping. 

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy spare parts for his vehicle as well as do frame repair work on the chassis as it is deteriorating, to buy a new exhaust and to do other repairs. This way he will repair his vehicle so that it will always be ready when his neighbours need his services and he will not miss out on the opportunity to make some money for his family.

He plans to save and to buy a good, recent model car and a boat.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle as well as do frame repair work on the chassis as it is deteriorating, to buy a new exhaust and to do other repairs.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has 8 children. They all live in a seven-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced some challenges in his life, among which are inadequate finances to start up a business, caring for his family's needs and dealing with the death of loved ones.  

With this loan he plans to buy a new motorcycle and pay for its required documents. He believes the business will succeed because he has been doing it for a long time. He has a good rider, the business is very profitable, and the business is very easy to manage. With this business activity, the community will benefit because it will ease their movement from one place to another.

With the profit from this loan, John will cater to his family's needs, ensure his children's education, and he will renovate his house. He prefers GHAPE loans because of their low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals. Also, the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to purchase a new bike and pay for its required documents.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, se le presenta la necesidad de más capital de trabajo, ya que iniciara el cultivo de maíz, es por ello que solicita un nuevo préstamo, el cual le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios,  tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas y pago de mano de obra.
El efecto del préstamo anterior fue favorable, ya que logro aumentar la productividad y los ingresos, estos los invierte en los gastos básicos del hogar. El cliente ha mejorado sus condiciones económicas, gracias a la inversión que realizo con el crédito que Kiva le otorgo, el grupo familiar se mantiene.
texts.en:
Irma needs more working capital because she's going to start her corn crop.  This is why she's requesting a loan, which will allow her to buy the necessary agricultural inputs such as soil amendments, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide, and to pay for labor.

The effect of the previous loan was favorable because she managed to increase productivity and her income, which she invests in her basic household expenses.  She has improved her economic conditions.  Thanks to the investment she made with the Kiva loan, she feeds her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to pay for labor

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is requesting a new loan to buy cellphones and household products such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cellphones and household products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em, 49, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Em has been running a general store in front of her house for twenty years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different household items (sanitation products, beverages and instant food) to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy household items such as sanitation products, beverages and instant food.

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en:
Kieu is 53 years old and is married with two children. Her husband is a driver for hire. She has been running a general store in front of her house for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Kieu is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more food and many kinds of soft drinks so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and soft drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es:
Ana tiene 50 años de edad. Se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa y enchapes,desde hace unos 7 años,  antes solo era una ama de casa. Ella comenta que la necesidad la llevo a pensar que hacer, para sacar a delante a sus hijos. Dice que un día que venia del hospital, con su hijo menor que hoy tiene trece años,desesperada pues viajaba hasta la capital del país y se le hacia difícil, para el pasaje caminando con su hijo de la mano, vio unas blusas y le gustaron y las compro y las llevo a vender a su cantón, y las vendió rápido, luego compro otras, y así inicio, el negocio de ropa. Después, comenzó a vender enchapes, eso le ha servido mucho, porque cuando la abandono su compañero de vida,ella sola ha podido sacar a delante a su familia.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 docena de blusas, 3 docenas blumeres, 3 docenas de tangas,3 docenas calcetines,2 docenas de faldas, 1 docena de brasieres,1 docena de delantares. Con la inversión , comprar más cantidad de mercadería y con más variedad para satisfacer a sus clientes, lo que evitara viajar tan seguido hasta la capital, debido a que el viaje dura unas dos horas de ida y otras dos de regreso a casa.

su sueño es tener su negocio mas fuerte, y  un puesto en el mercado. a demás sueña con que su hijo se prepare, y que se gradué en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old. She has been dedicated to selling clothes and tiles for seven years. Before she was just a housewife. She comments that necessity make her think about what to do to get her children ahead. She says that one day, she came from the hospital with her youngest son, who today is 13 years old, desperate because she traveled to the capital of the country and found it difficult. On the passage where she was walking holding her son's hand, she saw some blouses and she liked them and she bought them and took them to her region to sell. She sold them quickly and then bought others and thus started her clothing business. After, she began to sell tiles. This has served her well because when her husband left her, she alone was able to get her family ahead.

The loan that she is requesting from  Fundación Campo is to buy to buy 2 dozen blouses, 3 dozen pairs of underwear, 3 dozen thongs, 3 dozen socks, 2 dozen skirts,  a dozen bras, a dozen aprons. With the investment,she will buy a greater quantity of merchandise and greater variety to satisfy her customers. She avoids traveling to the capital because the trip takes 2 hours there and two hours to return home. 

Her dream is to have a stronger business and a stall in the market. She also dreams that her son studies and graduates from university.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen blouses, 3 dozen pairs of underwear, 3 dozen thongs, 3 dozen socks, 2 dozen skirts,  a dozen bras, a dozen aprons.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María tiene 28 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica al comercio desde hace unos 7 años. Antes se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos,pero cuando se acompaño, ella quizo ayudar a su  compañero,y primero se inicio haciendo pupusas con su suegra,luego aprendió también hacer hamburguesas, tortas mexicana. Después,  con su compañero instalaron una pequeña tienda que la iniciaron con cincuenta  dolares, y cada día ha ido creciendo, a demás instalaron un molino,para buscar siempre traer los alimentos para su familia.

Ella comenta que su vida es un poco agitada, se levanta a las 5: 00a.m. para atender los clientes,que llegan a comprar pan para el desayuno,por la tarde se desplaza a unos 10 minutos de su casa  para ir donde tiene el  cafetín donde vende pupusas,y regresa a su casa como las 5: 00 pm.ella cuenta que su sueño es tener su  tienda fuerte,

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación campo, es para comprar de 5 sacos  de maíz, 2 de frijoles, 2 quintales de arroz, 4 cajas de jabón de lavar ropa, 10 fardos de lejía, 10 fardos de detergente,3 garrafas de aceite,2 cajas de tomate, 5 cajas de sopas, 2 quintales de azúcar,3 fardos de papel higiénico,1 fardo de platos descartables, 3 estantes,10 cartones de huevos, 2 quintales de sal,1 caja de pasta de diente, 2cajas de fideos,cubitos, ademas quiere mejorar el local.

El préstamo, suplirá la necesidad, de poder mejorar su tienda, pues hay muchos productos que se los buscan y no los tiene,pero con el préstamo podrá darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. podrá tener mejores ganancias y ofrecerle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.


su sueño es tener su casa de ladrillo, pues la que hoy tiene es de adobe,a demas sueña con tener un minisuper, también sueña con un carro para transportar los productos, de la tienda.
texts.en:
María is twenty-eight years old, is married, and has two children.  She has been making a living in trade for about seven years.  Before this, she made a living in domestic services.  When she married, she wanted to help her husband and first began making stuffed tortillas with her mother-in-law.  Later, she also learned to make hamburgers and Mexican cakes.  She than set up a small shop with her husband.  They began with fifty dollars.  Every day, it has grown, and they have installed a grinding mill.  They do this so that they can always bring food home to their family.

She says that her life is a little difficult.  She gets up at 5:00am to attend to her customers that arrive to buy bread for breakfast.  In the afternoon, she goes about ten minutes away from her house to go to a cafeteria where she sells her stuffed tortillas.  She returns to her home at about 5:00pm.  She says that her dream is to have her own, strong store.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy five sacks of corn, two sacks of beans, 2 quintales (about 100 kilos) of rice, 4 boxes of soap to wash clothing, 10 bundles of bleach, 10 bundles of detergent, 3 demijohns of oil, 2 boxes of tomatoes, 5 boxes of soup, 2 quintales of sugar, 3 bundles of toilet paper, 1 bundle of disposable plates, 3 shelves, 10 cartons of eggs, 2 quintales of salt, 1 box of toothpaste, 2 boxes of noodles, and ice cube trays.  She also wants to improve her store premises.  

The loan will supply her with what she needs and will help her to be able to improve her store.  There are many products that customers ask for that she does not have.  With the loan, she will be able to provide a better service to her clients.  She will be able to make better profits and to offer a greater quality of life to her family.

Her dream is to have a house made of brick.  The house she currently has is made of adobe.  She also dreams of having a mini supermarket, and of having a car in order to transport her products from the store.

loans.use: to restock her store, and to also improve her premises.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en:
Thom, 55, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband started a general store 30 years ago. She sells household items such as shampoo, detergents, sanitation and personal products, food and beverages. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is a 53-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. To support their family, Phung and her husband earn an income by raising milking cows. They started this business 15 years ago. 

Phung would like to take a loan to expand her current business. With the loan, she will repair the barn. Phung hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To repair the barn.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in making a new activity and help her to earn income for her family. 

Anh would like to take a further loan to buy new equipment for her business of taking care of children of the people in her community. She will use a part of the loan to provide school fees for her children. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her business and to pay her child's school fees.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Nguyen's previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

Now she is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 
 
She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular confectionery and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Omar De Jesus

texts.es:
Omar, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para continuar invirtiendo en su oficio; este le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas oportunos para la agricultura, tales como; abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas, entre otros; esto ayudara a obtener una mejor producción.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que logro adquirir todo lo necesario para trabajar; las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, por lo que las condiciones económicas se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Omar is faced with the need for a new loan in order to continue investing in his work.  This loan will allow him to buy the appropriate farming materials for his fields, like fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide, pest-control substances, herbicide, and other items.  These products will help him to improve production.

The effect of the previous loan was positive.  He was able to acquire everything necessary for his work.  His familial situation and economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide, pest-control substances, herbicide, and other items.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy, a 40-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. She supports her family by running a business of processing  clothes. Thuy requests a loan to purchase a sewing machine. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her business and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 52, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. Her husband earns a living working as a guard. Hong lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hong has been in her business for eighteen years. She plans to use this loan to buy a new hair dryer machine. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new hair dryer.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a machinist. Dung earns an income by raising milking cows. She started this business 12 years ago. 

Dung would like to take a loan to expand her current business. With the loan, she will buy a milking cow. Phung hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc would like to take a further loan to repair her family's scooter, to buy soft drinks to sell to her customers, and to pay her children's school fees. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her family's scooter, to buy soft drinks to sell to her customers, and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira has been in the animal husbandry type of activity for the past three years and her goal is that soon she can expand the number of animals. But for now, she wants to add more dairy cows and to buy fodder with this loan.

Here it is what she said to the loan officer: “I want to invest in buying more dairy cows and start making cheese myself and selling it, instead of selling raw milk like I do now. For the moment it’s okay, though, I am content with the activity and the income I make out of it. This income enables me to raise and educate my three children who are still attending schools. We are together with my husband in it and this makes it easier for me. This will be my first loan and I am happy to request it because I will add some more cows.”

loans.use: to add more dairy cows and buy fodder for the animals.

loans.name: Flutur

texts.en:
Flutur is a 48-year-old villager and the mother of four children who wants to buy a dairy cow with some financial help through Kiva’s lenders. This will be her first loan.

Flutur has been practicing a livestock/agricultural type of activity for the past 15 years. Here is what she shared with the loan officer who interviewed her: “livestock is not easy at all because in addition to looking after the animals, we’ve got to milk them and sell the raw milk every day going door-to-door trying to sell to residents of a main nearby city. We also have to make cheese and cottage cheese ourselves, and try to sell this as well. So, all these activities require some daily hard work in almost all seasons around the year, and this is shown on me; I look so much older for my age, unfortunately,”

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Hoang is a 46-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working for a public service company. Hoang is running a general store, which she has done for 10 years. She would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa, 26, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Thoa and her husband have been running a general store in their community for 10 years. They sell household items to people. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of new products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of new products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Phuoc

texts.en: Phuoc would like to take a further loan to repair his house. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Maa Gouri Group

texts.en:
In the year 2011, five self-motivated women entrepreneurs of Bolangir town of Bolangir district in Odisha, India formed a group named Maa Gouri to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing business. Nalani, a most active lady, is one of them. She is standing on the extreme left with raised hand in the photograph. Nalani, aged 35 years, is a very energetic lady who lives with her husband; they have one son of 11 years of age who is continuing his studies in an English medium school. 

Nalani has been running a varied business of tailoring, a computer and Xerox center, and an Art and Music School for the last six years with the active help of her husband. She is directly concerned with the tailoring center. She takes order from the customers for stitching of ladies garments only. Due to her timely delivery and quality stitching, her reputation is increasing day by day. Being an educated woman she also helps her husband in managing the art and music school and computer and Xerox center. 

Nalani’s present dream is to give better education to her only son, so she is ceaselessly working for income generation. From the present loan she has planned to purchase raw materials like cloth, thread, and buttons, etc. for her tailoring center and accessories for the computer and Xerox center. She is confident that this investment must help her to increase her income. Nalani hopes to save enough money to establish the Art and Music school. 

The other four members of the group are Prema, Aladini, Kuni and Ratnamani who are involved in vegetable vending, Badi/papad making and selling, a betel nut shop and electrical & egg centre respectively.

loans.use: To pay for computer accessories, cloth, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Shyqyri

texts.en:
Shyqyri is starting up a business; buying agricultural fresh produce from the villagers around and selling it to the local markets of a nearby main city. He already has a transportation vehicle, and the loan he is requesting from Kiva lenders would be invested on buying produce for selling. 

According to his analysis of the market, he is certain that this activity will be a win-win situation and go well because it will allow farmers the time and energy to focus on their farming, compared to what they have been doing so far - farming plus finding ways to transport their produce every day before 5 am, which can be exhaustive. 

Shyqyri is in his early fifties and has four children who still attend schools.

loans.use: to buy fresh agricultural produce and sell it to the local market

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en:
Fatmir is a 35-year-old married father of two children, ages 6 and 2 .  He is requesting a loan to build a stable for his goats. 

He loves the animal husbandry activity, and specifically that of the goats. Quoted below is the conversation between him and the loan officer: 
“I started this activity almost ten years ago; I find so much joy even by looking at the goats and their babies. They are hard to manage, though, because they are very fast at moving, they basically run. But running after them, it keeps me fit too. I also enjoy making the cheese out of their milk that is very healthy, without much fat and cholesterol. So many people nowadays prefer such kind of cheese versus the cow or sheep one.”

Fatmir is requesting a loan for the first time to buy fodder for his goats.

loans.use: to buy fodder for the goats

loans.name: Dhurata

texts.en:
Dhurata has four young children and she is forty. They live in a village in the southeastern part of the country. Their region has been known for their traditional ‘melt in your mouth pies’ that are baked in a very primitive way. 

Here is the process; after they burn wood, on top of the coals, they put the dish and cover it with a lid called ‘saç’ with coals on top of that and ‘voila’ whether there was spinach or cheese or tomato with onions filling in the pie, it was just something else. It has also been traditional in their region that women wore an apron just like Dhurata in the picture. 

Up to now, Dhurata has had goats at home and she wants to add some dairy cows also. So far she has been selling the raw milk to some dairy farm in their vicinity where they produce goat cheese, specifically.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Tot

texts.en:
Tot, 47 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. 

She supports her family through the income she earns from running a food stall, selling meals to the people in her community. She began this business seven years ago. 

Tot intends to take a loan to buy food and furniture for her stall. The additional materials will enable her to increase her production and sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She would like to take a further loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Sadith, de 30 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Wilfredo y sus 4 hijos a quienes desea brindarles una buena calidad de vida. Sadith se dedica a la venta de refrescos y helados elaborados con frutas regionales como anona, aguaje, guineos, maracuyá y piña.  Para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con sus ahorros, ahí conserva a bajas temperaturas todos los productos que ofrece para que siempre estén refrescantes y al gusto del cliente. En la mañanas prepara todo lo necesario usando frutas de buena calidad y los vende por las tardes en los parques o colegios cercanos a su vivienda usando envases refrigerantes. Inició su trabajo hace 2 años y desde entonces lo realiza sola. Por fortuna logra vender diariamente gran parte de todos los helados que prepara. Le gusta su actividad ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando los frutos que esperaba, considera que le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene buenas ventas, genera buenos ingresos económicos y además progresa cada día mas, con el paso del tiempo espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos sin tener que salir a las calles.
En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.
El monto solicitado lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de algunos ingredientes como azúcar y frutas regionales para elaborar los deliciosos chupetes que pone a la venta.
texts.en: Sadith is 30 years old and lives in a house of her own with her husband, Wilfred, and their 4 children, whom she wants to give a better life. She sells soft drinks and iced lollipops made with regional fruit such as custard apple, moriche palm fruit, green bananas, passion fruit, and pineapple. To make her wares, she has a fridge she bought with her savings, where she keeps all her products at low temperatures so as to always have refreshing and tasty items for the customers. In the morning, Sadith makes everything she needs, using good-quality fruit, and goes out in the afternoon with a cooler to sell her wares in parks or in front of schools in her vicinity. She started this business two years ago and has always worked alone. Fortunately, she manages to sell most of her production on the same day she makes it. She loves her business because she feels that her hard work is finally paying off. She considers herself successful, since sales and profits are good, and the business grows a bit more every day. In time, she hopes to have a shop of her own, where she could stay instead of having to go out to sell her wares. Sadith asks for a loan of 1,500 soles, and says she is deeply moved by the fact that there are people ready to help her make her business grow, which is why she vows to always be punctual in her repayments and to use the money responsibly. Thus, the whole sum will go toward buying the ingredients she needs to make her delicious drinks and lollipops, such as sugar and regional fruit.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar and regional fruit.

loans.name: Petrit

texts.en:
Petrit is requesting a loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek in order to invest in dairy cows. These cows will be an addition to his existing herd of the same animals.

Petrit is a villager living in the vicinity of a main city in southeastern Albania. The village under the communist era was considered a picturesque place to visit; it had a river running through the village, with some centuries-old oak trees. Then, with the changes of the leadership styles and the rapid modernization, many objects that once were considered special turned into almost nothing until some sort of stabilization kicked in the recent years and those very same objects started to be maintained again by the government or local agencies.

Petrit is 41, married, and has two children.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and fodder for his animals

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y su esposo tiene 30 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 5 y 7 años. Ella, se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tamales, pasteles de carne, tortillas, el oficio lo realiza todos los días, actividad que lo aprendió con su madre, lo desempeña desde hace 10 años.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria, tales como: maíz, carne, elotes, aceite, condimentos, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su producción y obtener mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y fortalecer mas el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old. She is married, and her husband is 30. She has two children, ages 5 and 7. She makes her living making and selling tamales, meat pies, and tortillas. She does this activity every day; she learned it from her mother and has been doing this for 10 years.  
The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy necessary raw materials, such as corn, meat, oil, condiments, among others. This investment will allow her to increase her production and make more income.
Her dream is to give her family a better quality of life and to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy  corn, meat, oil, condiments, among others.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, está casada y disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 13 y 18 años. Ella, se dedica  a la venta de ropa, lo cual lo realiza en su casa y asimismo vende antojitos, tales como: pupusas, tostadas y esto lo lleva a cabo por las tardes, tambien vende peliculas y cds, cuenta con dos años de poseer el negocio.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar variedad de ropa, tales como: blusas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, trajes para niñas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos e incrementar su inventario. 
Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her family; she is married with two children ages 13 and 18. She sells clothing from her home. In the afternoons, she also sells food such as pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] and toast. She also sells movies and CDs. She has had this business for two years.
This loan will allow her to buy a variety of clothing such as blouses, shirts, pants, dresses, and girls' outfits. This investment will help her to obtain a greater income and expand her inventory.
Her dream is to strengthen her business and offer her family a  better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, dresses, girls' outfits, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo para su oficio de crianza de pollos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar pollos, concentrado, vitaminas, antibióticos, entre otros.
El préstamo anterior fue de mucha ventaja, ya que logro incrementar los inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos; sus condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan because he needs more working capital for raising chickens. This investment will help him to buy chickens, chicken feed, vitamins, antibiotics, and other items.
His previous loan helped him a great deal. He was able to increase his inventory and obtain a greater income. His economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed, vitamins, antibiotics, and other items.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman, who lives in a village close by a main city, is requesting a loan for the first time to add one more dairy cow to his existing herd of three cows. 

“I could not afford any sort of loans before, but now that the golden opportunity has been given to me to be a beneficiary of such a loan with lower rates,  then why not; I do not have to worry as much as I would have, if things were the same as before. I appreciate very much the opportunity, the organizations that have offered me such a leniency and the lenders,” is what Osman said while being interviewed by the loan officer.

Osman is 49 and married; he has two children almost grown-ups now. He has been selling raw milk at the local market of a nearby city for almost ten years now.

loans.use: to add one more milk cow to the existing herd of three cows.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is married and has three children.  She is experiencing growth in her business. She lives in Mariakani where she runs a food café. She is requesting another loan from Milango, which she will use to buy a freezer, tables, and chairs for her business. In the future, she has a vision of owning a restaurant. The major challenge for her is some of her customers eat on credit and delay paying her. The extra income will help her build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Maa Tulashi Group

texts.en:
Minati lives at Bhawanipatna the district headquarter of Kalahandi district Odisha, India. She is a headstrong and confident lady. The lady standing at the extreme right, raising her hand is Minati. She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and one daughter aged 13 and one son aged 12. 

Minati is doing tailoring as well as giving training as a tutor to girls at her home for the last two years. Minati gets a monthly income of Rs.6,000 (INR) from the above business. But that is not enough for the household expenses. Minati also wants to give better education to her children to make their careers bright. She needs financial support from Mahashakti to purchase more tailoring machines (Pico and interlock machines) and cloth. This will be her third loan.

In the year 2010, Minati along with three women formed a group named Maa Tulashi to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their business. In future she wants to be a professional tailoring tutor. 

The other three members of the group Banita, Joshna and Ratnamanjari need loans for a ladies' garments business, tailoring and rice businesses respectively.

loans.use: to purchase more tailoring machines (Pico and interlock machines) and cloth.

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en:
Cerilo is a 53 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Cerilo owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting bananas, corn, and coconut, which he sells to earn a living. He has been farming for many years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

Cerilo joined GDMPC in 2009 and is requesting a new loan for 15,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fertilizer and weeding maintenance items. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and weeding maintenance items

loans.name: Alva

texts.es:
Alva, de 40 años de edad, está casada con Alexander quien es empleado y padre de sus 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Alva se dedica a la confección de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional. Para empezar con su negocio compró una maquina de coser con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su casa propia donde atiende a sus clientes quienes la buscan por los detalles que aplica a cada prenda, a logrado ganarse la aceptación de sus clientes habituales quienes la recomiendan con otras personas. Se inició en esta labor hace 2 años en y hasta el momento lo viene realizando ella sola. Considera rentable su actividad por las ganancias económicas que recibe. Le gusta la confección porque le permite mantenerse ocupada en todo momento, además las ganancias económicas que obtiene le sirven para apoyar a su pareja en solventar los gastos de su hogar. Comenta que le incomoda un poco el cansancio físico que tiene en ocasiones debido a que pasa muchas horas sentada, a pesar de ello, no se desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. Tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y comprarse otras maquinas de coser para dar un mejor acabado a las prendas que confecciona. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de confección como telas, hilos, agujas, botones, blondas, elásticos, aplicaciones y otros de acuerdo al requerimiento de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alva, 40 years old, is married to Alexander, a worker and father to Alva's three children.  The family lives together in their own house. Alva makes a living producing clothes for men, women and children, having learned the trade at an education centre.  To start the business, Alva used her savings to buy a sewing machine.  It is now installed in her home, where her customers come to order each clothing item.  Alva has become accepted by regular customers, who recommend her services to other people.  Alva started this work two years ago and, up until now, she has been working alone.  Alva believes that her work is profitable because the money she earns allow her to support her husband with household costs.  Alva tells us that she sometimes finds the work physically tiring as she spends many hours seated.  In spite of this, though, she does not feel discouraged and continues working and putting in a lot of effort.  Alva plans to continue with her work and to buy other sewing machines in order to give a better finish to her clothes.  On this occasion Alva is applying for a loan of 3000 Nuevo Soles.  She is very excited to learn that there are people out there that can provide her with financial support in order to continue with her work.  Alva promises to be punctual and responsible with her repayments.

Alva will use this loan to buy material, threads, needles, buttons, blond lace, elastic and other materials that she needs for her customers.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, needles, buttons, and more.

loans.name: Deisy Lorena

texts.es:
Deisy, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio de venta de sorbetes de la nevería; esta inversión le ayudara a  comprar mercadería tales como: sorbetes, paletas, conos, siberianos, entre otros.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar la clientela y sus ganancias las invierte en los gastos básicos del hogar. El crédito otorgado por Kiva le permitió mejorar las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Deisy needs a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue with her ice cream business. This investment will allow her to buy more merchandise such as: sorbets, popsicles, cones, and ice cream bars.
Her previous loan helped her to increase her clientele and her income, and she invested her earnings in basic household costs. This loan on Kiva will allow her to improve her economic conditions and family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy sorbets, popsicles, cones, ice cream bars, and other items.

loans.name: Gricelda Yamileth

texts.es:
Gricelda, requiere de más capital de trabajo, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la granja de pollos; esto le ayudara a comprar gallinas ponedoras y concentrados para alimentarlas.
El crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que logro fortalecer su negocio  y aumentar sus ganancias, estas las invierte en los gastos básicos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Gricelda needs more working capital, so she is requesting a new loan to invest in her chicken farm. This will help her to buy laying hens and chicken feed.
Her previous loan was helpful. She was able to strengthen her business and increase her income. She invested her income in basic household costs; her economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy laying hens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Jorge De Jesus

texts.es:
Jorge, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para la agricultura, ya que iniciara la siembra de granos básicos; esta le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros.
El  crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que logro obtener mejores ingresos y esto los invierte en los gastos básicos de hogar, asimismo la producción incremento. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Jorge needs a new loan because he needs more working capital for agriculture. He is about to start sowing basic grains. This loan will allow him to buy the necessary agricultural supplies such as manure, insecticides, pesticides, and fungicides.
His previous loan had a positive impact. He was able to obtain a better income, and he invested this in basic household costs. His production also improved. His economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, pesticides, and fungicides, among other items.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is 28 years old, married and blessed with one child. She has been running a grocery store in her neighborhood for the last eight months. She has a vision to be running a wholesale business in the next five years. 

She knew Milango through friends, and she decided to join to be able to access credit to fund the business. She now seeks a loan to buy kale, tomatoes and onions for her grocery store. 

The challenge that she faces in the business is that during the low season, customers are few and her income is also limited. The extra income that she will raise from the business will help improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy kale, tomatoes and onions for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic items like cups, plates and cooking pots.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda works hard to support her family. She is widowed and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

Alfreda requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soft drinks, milk, noodles, egg, canned goods, etc.

Alfreda has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Alfreda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soft drinks, milk, noodles, egg, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 25 years old, married  and has one child who is in school.

Christine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Christine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Christine has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Christine would like to save enough money to ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 52 years old and married with three children.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar frutas y verduras, tales como: plátanos, manzanas, entre otros, también pescado. 
El efecto del crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que logro adquirir mercadería para la satisfacción de los clientes; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
María needs a new loan because she needs more working capital. This investment will help her to buy fruits and vegetables such as bananas and apples, as well as fish.
Her previous loan had a positive impact. She was able to acquire merchandise to satisfy her customers. Her economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, and other fruits as well as fish.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Malindi, Kenya, where she runs a retail shop. She is married and blessed with two children. Both of the children attend school. Her husband is also employed and earns a salary. She has been in the business for six years now. 

She knew Milango through friends at a time she wanted funding for the business. She now seeks a loan to buy sugar, rice, salt and other retail products for the shop. Her aim is to open other branches of her business and spread it in major towns. The major challenges for her in the business are competition and creditors not honoring their debts.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, salt and other retail products.

loans.name: Gricelda De Jesus

texts.es:
Gricelda, está casada y tiene una hija de 14 años de edad, no recibe ayuda del extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, dicha actividad   la inicio como sustento para la familia y lo realiza de 4:00pm a 8:00pm, lo desempeña desde hace 4 años.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar la materia prima, tales como: chicharrón, maíz, frijoles, loroco, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas.
Su sueño es optimizar el negocio y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gricelda is married with one 14-year-old daughter. She does not receive support from abroad. She makes and sells pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans]. She started this business to support her family, and works from 4:00 pm to 8:00 pm. She has been doing this for four years.
This loan will allow her to buy basic supplies such as chicharrón [pork rinds or cracklings], corn, beans, loroco [a Central American vine flower bud], and other items. This investment will help her to improve her business and increase her sales.
Her dream is to optimize her business and obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy chicharrón, corn, beans, loroco, and other items.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 43 años  de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 24 y 22 años de edad y junto a ellos vive cómodamente en su casa propia. Zonia se dedica a la venta de bebidas. Semanalmente llega el carro repartidor de una empresa cervecera hasta su local de atención ubicado en su hogar. Por fortuna, tiene una amplia vivienda hasta donde llegan deportistas de diversas disciplinas quienes luego de jugar van a refrescarse a su tienda. Realiza la venta directa de las bebidas gracias a que cuenta con algunas mesas y sillas en donde atiende cómodamente a sus consumidores. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad  más de 5 años y lo hace sola, además tiene otros negocios complementarios como la venta de golosinas y la crianza de aves. Le gusta lo que hace, pues brinda a sus clientes productos de reconocida calidad con mucha responsabilidad y medidas de seguridad complementarias, además con todo lo que ofrece puede tener buenas ventas y con esto mejorar los ingresos que necesita en la economía de su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará gaseosas y otras bebidas refrescantes para continuar con las ventas en su negocio.
texts.en: Zonia, age 43, is a single mother. She has two children ages 24 and 22 and lives with them comfortably in her own home. Zonia sells drinks. The delivery truck arrives weekly from a beer company directly to her business, which is located in her home. Luckily, she has a large home. After playing sports, sportsmen from every sport go to her store to get refreshments. She has some tables and chairs, so she is able to provide comfortable customer service. She has had this business for over five years and works alone. She also has other complementary businesses such as candy sales and raising birds. She likes what she does; she offers her customers recognized, quality products with a great deal of responsibility and security. Because she sells so much, she has good sales and is able to bring in a good income for her household. She is requesting 2000 soles and is grateful and happy to know that she continues to have the financial support she needs to move forward with her business. With this loan, she will buy pop and other refreshments to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy pop and other refreshments.

loans.name: Bernadete

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Bernadete to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as chicken pieces, buffalo meat, and pork. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Bernadete independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicken pieces, buffalo meat, and pork

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Lolita has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from her general store.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria nació en la ciudad de Cusco pero ahora vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo, ella tiene 49 años y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella tiene una pequeña librería y heladería y le va muy bien, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace varios entonces en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo helados, gaseosas, agua mineral, papeles, lapiceros, cuadernos y otras cosa más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Maria was born in the city of Cusco but currently lives in the beautiful city of Puacartambo. She is 49 and in a common-law marriage. She has two children and is a hard-working and enterprising mother who supports her children through her hard work. She has a small and very successful bookstore and ice cream shop. She has belonged to the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank for some time now. She needs this loan for the purchase of merchandise such as ice cream, pop, mineral water, paper, pens, and notebooks. She is grateful for this loan and values it, and promises to repay her monthly quotas very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as ice cream, pop, mineral water, paper, pens, and notebooks.

loans.name: Jose Arquimides

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para el cultivo de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar materiales agrícolas, tales como: herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono, entre otros.
El préstamo anterior le fue de mucha utilidad, ya que la producción aumento y sus ingresos los invierte en los gastos de la alimentación y vestuario de sus hijos. Las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en: Jose needs a new loan because he needs more working capital so he can raise his basic grains.  This will allow him to buy farming supplies such as herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, insecticides, fertilizer and other things.   The previous loan was of great help and his production increased.  He spends his earnings on feeding and clothing his children.  The family finances have improved.

loans.use: to buy supplies.
